   105‚Üí    Args:

   110‚Üí    """

   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí    Args:
   122‚Üí        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
   123‚Üí        lines_covered: Number of covered lines
   124‚Üí        lines_valid: Number of valid lines
   125‚Üí    """
   126‚Üí    print("üìä COVERAGE ANALYSIS REPORT")
   127‚Üí    print("=" * 50)
   128‚Üí    print(f"Overall Coverage: {line_rate:.1%} ({lines_covered}/{lines_valid} lines)")
   129‚Üí    print()
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üídef _evaluate_quality_gate(

   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí    Args:
   138‚Üí        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
   139‚Üí        target_coverage: Target coverage goal
   140‚Üí        minimum_coverage: Minimum coverage threshold
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí    Returns:
   143‚Üí        Quality gate status string
   144‚Üí    """
   145‚Üí    if line_rate >= target_coverage:
   146‚Üí        print("‚úÖ EXCELLENT: Coverage exceeds 80% target!")
   147‚Üí        return "PASSED"
   148‚Üí    elif line_rate >= minimum_coverage:
   149‚Üí        print("‚úÖ GOOD: Coverage meets minimum 49% gate")
   150‚Üí        progress = (line_rate - minimum_coverage) / (target_coverage - minimum_coverage)
   151‚Üí        print(f"üéØ Progress to 80% target: {progress:.1%}")
   152‚Üí        return "PASSED"
   153‚Üí    else:
   154‚Üí        print("‚ùå FAILED: Coverage below 49% minimum gate")
   155‚Üí        return "FAILED"

   157‚Üí
   158‚Üídef _print_module_analysis(modules: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
   159‚Üí    """Print module-by-module analysis.
   160‚Üí
   161‚Üí    Args:
   162‚Üí        modules: List of module data dictionaries
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí    Returns:
   165‚Üí        List of modules needing attention
   166‚Üí    """
   167‚Üí    print("\nüîç MODULES NEEDING ATTENTION (Coverage < 80%):")

   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí    needs_attention = []
   171‚Üí    for module in modules:
   172‚Üí        if module["coverage"] < 0.80:
   173‚Üí            print(
   174‚Üí                f"{module['file']:<40} {module['coverage']:>6.1%} ({module['covered']}/{module['total']} lines)"
   175‚Üí            )
   176‚Üí            needs_attention.append(module)
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí    if not needs_attention:
   179‚Üí        print("üéâ All modules have excellent coverage (80%+)!")
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí    print("\nüåü HIGH COVERAGE MODULES (80%+):")
   182‚Üí    print("-" * 60)
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üí    excellent_modules = [m for m in modules if m["coverage"] >= 0.80]
   185‚Üí    for module in excellent_modules:
   186‚Üí        print(
   187‚Üí            f"{module['file']:<40} {module['coverage']:>6.1%} ({module['covered']}/{module['total']} lines)"
   188‚Üí        )
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí    return needs_attention
   191‚Üí
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üídef _print_quality_gate_analysis(
   194‚Üí    line_rate: float, target_coverage: float, lines_valid: int, lines_covered: int
   195‚Üí) -> None:
   196‚Üí    """Print quality gate analysis.
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí    Args:
   199‚Üí        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
   200‚Üí        target_coverage: Target coverage goal
   201‚Üí        lines_valid: Number of valid lines
   202‚Üí        lines_covered: Number of covered lines
   203‚Üí    """
   204‚Üí    print()
   205‚Üí    print("üéØ QUALITY GATE ANALYSIS")
   206‚Üí    print("-" * 30)
   207‚Üí    print(f"Current Coverage: {line_rate:.1%}")
   208‚Üí    print(f"Minimum Gate (49%): {'‚úÖ PASS' if line_rate >= 0.49 else '‚ùå FAIL'}")
   209‚Üí    print(f"Target Goal (80%): {'‚úÖ PASS' if line_rate >= 0.80 else '‚è≥ IN PROGRESS'}")
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí    if line_rate < target_coverage:
   212‚Üí        lines_needed = int((target_coverage * lines_valid) - lines_covered)
   213‚Üí        print(f"üìà Lines needed for 80%: {lines_needed}")
   214‚Üí        print(f"üìà Current gap: {(target_coverage - line_rate):.1%}")
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí
   217‚Üídef _extract_module_data(root: Any) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
   218‚Üí    """Extract module coverage data from XML root.
   219‚Üí
   220‚Üí    Args:
   221‚Üí        root: XML root element
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí    Returns:
   224‚Üí        List of module data dictionaries
   225‚Üí    """
   226‚Üí    modules = []
   227‚Üí    packages = root.findall(".//package")
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí    for package in packages:
   230‚Üí        package_name = package.get("name", ".")
   231‚Üí        classes = package.findall(".//class")
   232‚Üí
   233‚Üí        for class_elem in classes:
   234‚Üí            filename = class_elem.get("filename", "")
   235‚Üí            class_rate = float(class_elem.get("line-rate", 0))
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí            if filename:
   238‚Üí                # Calculate lines for this class
   239‚Üí                lines = class_elem.findall(".//line")
   240‚Üí                total_lines = len(lines)
   241‚Üí                covered_lines = len(
   242‚Üí                    [line for line in lines if int(line.get("hits", 0)) > 0]
   243‚Üí                )
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí                modules.append(
   246‚Üí                    {
   247‚Üí                        "file": filename,
   248‚Üí                        "coverage": class_rate,
   249‚Üí                        "covered": covered_lines,
   250‚Üí                        "total": total_lines,
   251‚Üí                        "package": package_name,
   252‚Üí                    }
   253‚Üí                )
   254‚Üí
   255‚Üí    return modules
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üídef _print_coverage_issues(modules: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
   259‚Üí    """Print coverage issues analysis.
   260‚Üí
   261‚Üí    Args:
   262‚Üí        modules: List of module data dictionaries
   263‚Üí    """
   264‚Üí    issues = []
   265‚Üí
   266‚Üí    # Check for zero coverage modules
   267‚Üí    zero_coverage = [m for m in modules if m["coverage"] == 0]
   268‚Üí    if zero_coverage:
   269‚Üí        issues.append(f"‚ùå {len(zero_coverage)} modules with 0% coverage")
   270‚Üí        for module in zero_coverage[:5]:  # Show first 5
   271‚Üí            print(f"   ‚Ä¢ {module['file']}")
   272‚Üí        if len(zero_coverage) > 5:
   273‚Üí            print(f"   ‚Ä¢ ... and {len(zero_coverage) - 5} more")
   274‚Üí
   275‚Üí    # Check for low coverage modules
   276‚Üí    low_coverage = [m for m in modules if 0 < m["coverage"] < 0.30]
   277‚Üí    if low_coverage:
   278‚Üí        issues.append(f"‚ö†Ô∏è  {len(low_coverage)} modules with <30% coverage")
   279‚Üí
   280‚Üí    # Check for medium coverage modules that could be improved
   281‚Üí    medium_coverage = [m for m in modules if 0.30 <= m["coverage"] < 0.80]
   282‚Üí    if medium_coverage:
   283‚Üí        issues.append(
   284‚Üí            f"üìà {len(medium_coverage)} modules with 30-79% coverage (improvable)"
   285‚Üí        )
   286‚Üí
   287‚Üí    if not issues:
   288‚Üí        print("üéâ No major coverage issues found!")
   289‚Üí
   290‚Üí
   291‚Üídef _print_recommendations(
   292‚Üí    line_rate: float, minimum_coverage: float, target_coverage: float
   293‚Üí) -> None:
   294‚Üí    """Print recommendations based on coverage levels.
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí    Args:
   297‚Üí        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
   298‚Üí        minimum_coverage: Minimum coverage threshold
   299‚Üí        target_coverage: Target coverage goal
   300‚Üí    """
   301‚Üí    if line_rate < minimum_coverage:
   302‚Üí        print("üî• URGENT: Focus on modules with 0% coverage first")
   303‚Üí        print("üî• URGENT: Add basic unit tests for core functionality")
   304‚Üí        print("üî• URGENT: Fix any broken test infrastructure")
   305‚Üí    elif line_rate < target_coverage:
   306‚Üí        print("üìä Add comprehensive tests for modules <80% coverage")
   307‚Üí        print("üß™ Focus on edge cases and error handling")
   308‚Üí        print("üîÑ Add integration tests for component interactions")
   309‚Üí    else:
   310‚Üí        print("üåü Maintain current excellent coverage levels")
   311‚Üí        print("üß™ Consider adding performance and security tests")
   312‚Üí        print("üìà Focus on test quality and maintainability")
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí
   315‚Üídef _print_next_steps(needs_attention: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
   316‚Üí    """Print next steps for improving coverage.
   317‚Üí
   318‚Üí    Args:
   319‚Üí        needs_attention: List of modules needing attention
   320‚Üí    """
   321‚Üí    if needs_attention:
   322‚Üí        priority_modules = needs_attention[:3]
   323‚Üí        print("1. Priority modules to improve:")
   324‚Üí        for i, module in enumerate(priority_modules, 1):
   325‚Üí            print(f"   {i}. {module['file']} ({module['coverage']:.1%})")
   326‚Üí
   327‚Üí    print("2. Run focused test suite:")
   328‚Üí    print("   pytest --cov=src --cov-report=xml --cov-report=html")
   329‚Üí
   330‚Üí    print("3. Generate detailed HTML report:")
   331‚Üí    print("   open htmlcov/index.html")
   332‚Üí
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üídef main() -> None:
   335‚Üí    """Main function to analyze coverage."""
   336‚Üí    xml_path = "coverage.xml"
   337‚Üí
   338‚Üí    if len(sys.argv) > 1:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Analyze coverage.xml and identify issues that need to be addressed for quality gates."""

import sys
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Any, Dict, List

# Use defusedxml for secure XML parsing
try:
    import defusedxml
    import defusedxml.ElementTree as ET

    defusedxml.defuse_stdlib()
except ImportError:
    # Fallback to standard library with warning
    import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET

    print(
        "‚ö†Ô∏è  Warning: Using standard xml.etree.ElementTree. Install defusedxml for security."
    )


def analyze_coverage_xml(xml_path: str) -> bool:
    """Analyze coverage.xml and provide detailed insights.

    Args:
        xml_path: Path to the coverage.xml file

    Returns:
        bool: True if quality gate passes, False otherwise
    """
    if not Path(xml_path).exists():
        print(f"‚ùå Coverage file not found: {xml_path}")
        return False

    try:
        tree = ET.parse(xml_path)
        root = tree.getroot()

        # Get overall coverage
        coverage_data = _get_coverage_data(root)
        line_rate = coverage_data["line_rate"]
        lines_covered = coverage_data["lines_covered"]
        lines_valid = coverage_data["lines_valid"]

        _print_header(line_rate, lines_covered, lines_valid)

        # Quality gate thresholds
        target_coverage = 0.80  # 80%
        minimum_coverage = 0.49  # 49% (current gate)

        quality_status = _evaluate_quality_gate(
            line_rate, target_coverage, minimum_coverage
        )

        print()
        print("üìÅ MODULE-BY-MODULE ANALYSIS")
        print("-" * 50)

        modules = _extract_module_data(root)

        # Sort by coverage (lowest first)
        modules.sort(key=lambda x: x["coverage"])

        needs_attention = _print_module_analysis(modules)

        _print_quality_gate_analysis(
            line_rate, target_coverage, lines_valid, lines_covered
        )

        print()
        print("üö® COMMON ISSUES TO ADDRESS:")
        print("-" * 35)

        _print_coverage_issues(modules)

        print()
        print("üîß RECOMMENDATIONS:")
        print("-" * 20)

        _print_recommendations(line_rate, minimum_coverage, target_coverage)

        print()
        print("üìã NEXT STEPS:")
        print("-" * 15)

        _print_next_steps(needs_attention)

        print()
        print(f"üèÜ QUALITY GATE STATUS: {quality_status}")

        return quality_status == "PASSED"

    except ET.ParseError as e:
        print(f"‚ùå Error parsing coverage.xml: {e}")
        return False
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"‚ùå Unexpected error: {e}")
        return False


def _get_coverage_data(root: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """Extract coverage data from XML root.

    Args:
        root: XML root element

    Returns:
        Dictionary with coverage data
    """
    return {
        "lines_valid": int(root.get("lines-valid", 0)),
        "lines_covered": int(root.get("lines-covered", 0)),
        "line_rate": float(root.get("line-rate", 0)),
    }


def _print_header(line_rate: float, lines_covered: int, lines_valid: int) -> None:
    """Print the coverage analysis header.

    Args:
        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
        lines_covered: Number of covered lines
        lines_valid: Number of valid lines
    """
    print("üìä COVERAGE ANALYSIS REPORT")
    print("=" * 50)
    print(f"Overall Coverage: {line_rate:.1%} ({lines_covered}/{lines_valid} lines)")
    print()


def _evaluate_quality_gate(
    line_rate: float, target_coverage: float, minimum_coverage: float
) -> str:
    """Evaluate quality gate status.

    Args:
        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
        target_coverage: Target coverage goal
        minimum_coverage: Minimum coverage threshold

    Returns:
        Quality gate status string
    """
    if line_rate >= target_coverage:
        print("‚úÖ EXCELLENT: Coverage exceeds 80% target!")
        return "PASSED"
    elif line_rate >= minimum_coverage:
        print("‚úÖ GOOD: Coverage meets minimum 49% gate")
        progress = (line_rate - minimum_coverage) / (target_coverage - minimum_coverage)
        print(f"üéØ Progress to 80% target: {progress:.1%}")
        return "PASSED"
    else:
        print("‚ùå FAILED: Coverage below 49% minimum gate")
        return "FAILED"


def _print_module_analysis(modules: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    """Print module-by-module analysis.

    Args:
        modules: List of module data dictionaries

    Returns:
        List of modules needing attention
    """
    print("\nüîç MODULES NEEDING ATTENTION (Coverage < 80%):")
    print("-" * 60)

    needs_attention = []
    for module in modules:
        if module["coverage"] < 0.80:
            print(
                f"{module['file']:<40} {module['coverage']:>6.1%} ({module['covered']}/{module['total']} lines)"
            )
            needs_attention.append(module)

    if not needs_attention:
        print("üéâ All modules have excellent coverage (80%+)!")

    print("\nüåü HIGH COVERAGE MODULES (80%+):")
    print("-" * 60)

    excellent_modules = [m for m in modules if m["coverage"] >= 0.80]
    for module in excellent_modules:
        print(
            f"{module['file']:<40} {module['coverage']:>6.1%} ({module['covered']}/{module['total']} lines)"
        )

    return needs_attention


def _print_quality_gate_analysis(
    line_rate: float, target_coverage: float, lines_valid: int, lines_covered: int
) -> None:
    """Print quality gate analysis.

    Args:
        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
        target_coverage: Target coverage goal
        lines_valid: Number of valid lines
        lines_covered: Number of covered lines
    """
    print()
    print("üéØ QUALITY GATE ANALYSIS")
    print("-" * 30)
    print(f"Current Coverage: {line_rate:.1%}")
    print(f"Minimum Gate (49%): {'‚úÖ PASS' if line_rate >= 0.49 else '‚ùå FAIL'}")
    print(f"Target Goal (80%): {'‚úÖ PASS' if line_rate >= 0.80 else '‚è≥ IN PROGRESS'}")

    if line_rate < target_coverage:
        lines_needed = int((target_coverage * lines_valid) - lines_covered)
        print(f"üìà Lines needed for 80%: {lines_needed}")
        print(f"üìà Current gap: {(target_coverage - line_rate):.1%}")


def _extract_module_data(root: Any) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
    """Extract module coverage data from XML root.

    Args:
        root: XML root element

    Returns:
        List of module data dictionaries
    """
    modules = []
    packages = root.findall(".//package")

    for package in packages:
        package_name = package.get("name", ".")
        classes = package.findall(".//class")

        for class_elem in classes:
            filename = class_elem.get("filename", "")
            class_rate = float(class_elem.get("line-rate", 0))

            if filename:
                # Calculate lines for this class
                lines = class_elem.findall(".//line")
                total_lines = len(lines)
                covered_lines = len(
                    [line for line in lines if int(line.get("hits", 0)) > 0]
                )

                modules.append(
                    {
                        "file": filename,
                        "coverage": class_rate,
                        "covered": covered_lines,
                        "total": total_lines,
                        "package": package_name,
                    }
                )

    return modules


def _print_coverage_issues(modules: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
    """Print coverage issues analysis.

    Args:
        modules: List of module data dictionaries
    """
    issues = []

    # Check for zero coverage modules
    zero_coverage = [m for m in modules if m["coverage"] == 0]
    if zero_coverage:
        issues.append(f"‚ùå {len(zero_coverage)} modules with 0% coverage")
        for module in zero_coverage[:5]:  # Show first 5
            print(f"   ‚Ä¢ {module['file']}")
        if len(zero_coverage) > 5:
            print(f"   ‚Ä¢ ... and {len(zero_coverage) - 5} more")

    # Check for low coverage modules
    low_coverage = [m for m in modules if 0 < m["coverage"] < 0.30]
    if low_coverage:
        issues.append(f"‚ö†Ô∏è  {len(low_coverage)} modules with <30% coverage")

    # Check for medium coverage modules that could be improved
    medium_coverage = [m for m in modules if 0.30 <= m["coverage"] < 0.80]
    if medium_coverage:
        issues.append(
            f"üìà {len(medium_coverage)} modules with 30-79% coverage (improvable)"
        )

    if not issues:
        print("üéâ No major coverage issues found!")


def _print_recommendations(
    line_rate: float, minimum_coverage: float, target_coverage: float
) -> None:
    """Print recommendations based on coverage levels.

    Args:
        line_rate: Current line coverage rate
        minimum_coverage: Minimum coverage threshold
        target_coverage: Target coverage goal
    """
    if line_rate < minimum_coverage:
        print("üî• URGENT: Focus on modules with 0% coverage first")
        print("üî• URGENT: Add basic unit tests for core functionality")
        print("üî• URGENT: Fix any broken test infrastructure")
    elif line_rate < target_coverage:
        print("üìä Add comprehensive tests for modules <80% coverage")
        print("üß™ Focus on edge cases and error handling")
        print("üîÑ Add integration tests for component interactions")
    else:
        print("üåü Maintain current excellent coverage levels")
        print("üß™ Consider adding performance and security tests")
        print("üìà Focus on test quality and maintainability")


def _print_next_steps(needs_attention: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> None:
    """Print next steps for improving coverage.

    Args:
        needs_attention: List of modules needing attention
    """
    if needs_attention:
        priority_modules = needs_attention[:3]
        print("1. Priority modules to improve:")
        for i, module in enumerate(priority_modules, 1):
            print(f"   {i}. {module['file']} ({module['coverage']:.1%})")

    print("2. Run focused test suite:")
    print("   pytest --cov=src --cov-report=xml --cov-report=html")

    print("3. Generate detailed HTML report:")
    print("   open htmlcov/index.html")


def main() -> None:
    """Main function to analyze coverage."""
    xml_path = "coverage.xml"

    if len(sys.argv) > 1:
        xml_path = sys.argv[1]

    success = analyze_coverage_xml(xml_path)
    sys.exit(0 if success else 1)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

"""
FastAPI application for the FirstSpirit Local Agent.

This module provides REST API endpoints for FirstSpirit code generation,
pattern learning, and memory management.
"""

import logging
from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional

import uvicorn
from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field

# Import LocalCodeAgent from the new implementation
from agent_clean import LocalCodeAgent
from backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaClient
from generator import CodeGenerator
from memory import Memory
from constants import AGENT_NOT_INITIALIZED, PROGRAMMING_LANGUAGE

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

# Initialize FastAPI app
app = FastAPI(
    title="FirstSpirit Local Agent API",
    description="API for FirstSpirit code generation and pattern learning",
    version="1.0.0",
)

# Add CORS middleware
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

# Global agent instance
agent: Optional[LocalCodeAgent] = None


# Pydantic models for API requests/responses
class GenerateRequest(BaseModel):
    task: str = Field(
        ..., description="Task description (e.g., 'input-component', 'output-channel')"
    )
    language: str = Field("java", description=PROGRAMMING_LANGUAGE)
    extra_context: Optional[str] = Field(
        None, description="Additional context or requirements"
    )
    max_attempts: int = Field(2, description="Maximum generation attempts")


class LearnRequest(BaseModel):
    before: str = Field(..., description="Original code or pattern")
    after: str = Field(..., description="Transformed/good code or pattern")
    task: str = Field(..., description="Task type")
    language: str = Field("java", description=PROGRAMMING_LANGUAGE)
    quality_score: float = Field(1.0, description="Quality score (0.0-1.0)")
    metadata: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = Field(None, description="Additional metadata")


class FirstSpiritComponentRequest(BaseModel):
    name: str = Field(..., description="Component name")
    type: str = Field("String", description="Value type for input components")
    language: str = Field("java", description=PROGRAMMING_LANGUAGE)
    extra_context: Optional[str] = Field(None, description="Additional requirements")


class GenerateResponse(BaseModel):
    success: bool
    generated_code: str
    confidence: float
    improvement_score: float
    attempts: List[Dict[str, Any]]
    metadata: Dict[str, Any]


class MemoryStatsResponse(BaseModel):
    total_patterns: int
    total_failed_patterns: int
    language_distribution: Dict[str, int]
    task_type_distribution: Dict[str, int]
    quality_stats: Dict[str, float]


class HealthResponse(BaseModel):
    status: str
    ollama_healthy: bool
    model_available: bool
    memory_healthy: bool
    agent_ready: bool


@app.on_event("startup")
async def startup_event():
    """Initialize the agent on startup."""
    global agent
    try:
        # Initialize components
        memory = Memory(db_path="fs_memory.db")
        ollama_client = OllamaClient(base_url="http://localhost:11434", timeout=60)
        code_generator = CodeGenerator(
            ollama_client=ollama_client,
            memory_db=memory,
            model_name="codellama:13b-instruct",
            embedding_model="nomic-embed-text",
        )

        # Initialize agent
        agent = LocalCodeAgent(
            memory=memory, code_generator=code_generator, project_root=".."
        )

        logger.info("FirstSpirit Local Agent initialized successfully")

    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to initialize agent: {e}")
        raise


@app.on_event("shutdown")
async def shutdown_event():
    """Cleanup resources on shutdown."""
    if agent:
        # Cleanup any resources if needed
        logger.info("FirstSpirit Local Agent shutdown complete")


@app.get("/", response_model=Dict[str, str])
async def root():
    """Root endpoint."""
    return {"message": "FirstSpirit Local Agent API", "version": "1.0.0"}


@app.get("/health", response_model=HealthResponse)
async def health_check():
    """Health check endpoint."""

    ollama_healthy = False
    model_available = False
    memory_healthy = False
    agent_ready = False

    try:
        if agent:
            # Check Ollama health
            ollama_healthy = agent.code_generator.ollama_client.health_check()

            # Check model availability
            models = await agent.code_generator.ollama_client.list_models()
            model_available = any(
                model["name"] == "codellama:13b-instruct" for model in models
            )

            # Check memory health
            try:
                agent.memory.get_statistics()
                memory_healthy = True
            except Exception:
                memory_healthy = False

            agent_ready = True

    except Exception as e:
        logger.warning(f"Health check failed: {e}")

    return HealthResponse(
        status="healthy" if agent_ready else "unhealthy",
        ollama_healthy=ollama_healthy,
        model_available=model_available,
        memory_healthy=memory_healthy,
        agent_ready=agent_ready,
    )


@app.post("/generate", response_model=GenerateResponse)
async def generate_code(request: GenerateRequest):
    """Main code generation endpoint."""

    if not agent:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=503, detail=AGENT_NOT_INITIALIZED)

    try:
        result = await agent.process_code(
            task=request.task,
            language=request.language,
            extra_context=request.extra_context or "",
            max_attempts=request.max_attempts,
        )

        if not result["result"]:
            raise HTTPException(
                status_code=500, detail="Failed to generate code after all attempts"
            )

        response = result["result"]

        return GenerateResponse(
            success=response.success,
            generated_code=response.generated_code,
            confidence=response.confidence,
            improvement_score=result["improvement_score"],
            attempts=result["attempts"],
            metadata=response.metadata,
        )

    except HTTPException:
        raise
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error generating code: {e}")
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))


@app.post("/learn")
async def learn_pattern(request: LearnRequest):
    """Store a good code pattern manually."""

    if not agent:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=503, detail=AGENT_NOT_INITIALIZED)

    try:
        pattern_id = agent.memory.store_successful_pattern(
            before=request.before,
            after=request.after,
            task=request.task,
            language=request.language,
            quality_score=request.quality_score,
            metadata=request.metadata or {},
        )

        return {
            "success": True,
            "pattern_id": pattern_id,
            "message": "Pattern stored successfully",
        }

    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error storing pattern: {e}")
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))


@app.get("/memory/stats", response_model=MemoryStatsResponse)
async def memory_stats():
    """Get memory statistics and pattern counts."""

    if not agent:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=503, detail=AGENT_NOT_INITIALIZED)

    try:
        stats = agent.memory.get_statistics()

        return MemoryStatsResponse(
            total_patterns=stats["total_patterns"],
            total_failed_patterns=stats["total_failed_patterns"],
            language_distribution=stats["language_distribution"],
            task_type_distribution=stats["task_type_distribution"],
            quality_stats=stats["quality_stats"],
        )

    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error getting memory stats: {e}")
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))


@app.post("/firstspirit/input-component", response_model=GenerateResponse)
async def quick_input_component(request: FirstSpiritComponentRequest):
    """Quick FirstSpirit input component generator."""

    if not agent:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=503, detail=AGENT_NOT_INITIALIZED)

    try:
        # Build specific context for input component
        extra_context = f"""
        Create a FirstSpirit input component with:
        - Name: {request.name}
        - Type: {request.type}
        - Language: {request.language}
        {request.extra_context or ""}

        The component should extend AbstractInputComponent<{request.type}> and include proper validation.
        """

        result = await agent.process_code(
            task="input-component",
            language=request.language,
            extra_context=extra_context,
            max_attempts=2,
        )

        if not result["result"]:
            raise HTTPException(
                status_code=500, detail="Failed to generate input component"
            )

        response = result["result"]

        return GenerateResponse(
            success=response.success,
            generated_code=response.generated_code,
            confidence=response.confidence,
            improvement_score=result["improvement_score"],
            attempts=result["attempts"],
            metadata=response.metadata,
        )

    except HTTPException:
        raise
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error generating input component: {e}")
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))


@app.post("/firstspirit/output-channel", response_model=GenerateResponse)
async def quick_output_channel(request: FirstSpiritComponentRequest):
    """Quick FirstSpirit output channel generator."""

    if not agent:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=503, detail=AGENT_NOT_INITIALIZED)

    try:
        # Build specific context for output channel
        extra_context = f"""
        Create a FirstSpirit output channel with:
        - Name: {request.name}
        - Language: {request.language}
        {request.extra_context or ""}

        The output channel should extend AbstractOutputChannel and generate appropriate output.
        """

        result = await agent.process_code(
            task="output-channel",
            language=request.language,
            extra_context=extra_context,
            max_attempts=2,
        )

        if not result["result"]:
            raise HTTPException(
                status_code=500, detail="Failed to generate output channel"
            )

        response = result["result"]

        return GenerateResponse(
            success=response.success,
            generated_code=response.generated_code,
            confidence=response.confidence,
            improvement_score=result["improvement_score"],
            attempts=result["attempts"],
            metadata=response.metadata,
        )

    except HTTPException:
        raise
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error generating output channel: {e}")
        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))


if __name__ == "__main__":
    import os

    # Use environment variables for secure configuration
    host = os.getenv("FS_API_HOST", "127.0.0.1")  # Default to localhost for security
    port = int(os.getenv("FS_API_PORT", "8000"))

    # Only bind to all interfaces if explicitly configured
    if host == "0.0.0.0":
        logger.warning(
            "Binding to all interfaces (0.0.0.0) - ensure firewall is configured"
        )

    uvicorn.run(app, host=host, port=port)

     2‚Üí"""

     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíUses FastAPI TestClient for realistic testing of all endpoints:

    10‚Üí- Authentication and validation paths
    11‚Üí"""
    12‚Üí

    94‚Üíclass TestAnalysisEndpoints:
    95‚Üí    """Test code analysis endpoints."""
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí    def test_analyze_file_success(self):
    98‚Üí        """Test successful file analysis."""
    99‚Üí        with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w", suffix=".py", delete=False) as f:
   100‚Üí            f.write("def test_function():\n    return 'test'")
   101‚Üí            temp_file = f.name
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üí        try:
   104‚Üí            response = client.post(
   105‚Üí                "/analyze", json={"file_path": temp_file, "store_patterns": True}
   106‚Üí            )
   107‚Üí            assert response.status_code == 200
   108‚Üí            data = response.json()
   109‚Üí            assert "patterns_stored" in data
   110‚Üí            assert "issues_found" in data
   111‚Üí            assert "complexity_score" in data
   112‚Üí            assert "recommendations" in data
   113‚Üí        finally:
   114‚Üí            Path(temp_file).unlink()
   115‚Üí
   116‚Üí    def test_analyze_file_not_found(self):
   117‚Üí        """Test analysis with non-existent file."""
   118‚Üí        response = client.post(
   119‚Üí            "/analyze",
   120‚Üí            json={"file_path": "/non/existent/file.py", "store_patterns": True},
   121‚Üí        )
   122‚Üí        assert response.status_code == 400  # API validation catches invalid paths
   123‚Üí
   124‚Üí    def test_analyze_file_invalid_path(self):
   125‚Üí        """Test analysis with invalid file path."""
   126‚Üí        response = client.post(
   127‚Üí            "/analyze",
   128‚Üí            json={"file_path": "../../../etc/passwd", "store_patterns": True},
   129‚Üí        )
   130‚Üí        # Should be rejected for security reasons

   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí    def test_upload_and_analyze_success(self):
   134‚Üí        """Test file upload and analysis."""
   135‚Üí        test_code = "def test_function():\n    return 'test'"
   136‚Üí
   137‚Üí        with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w", suffix=".py", delete=False) as f:
   138‚Üí            f.write(test_code)
   139‚Üí            temp_file = f.name
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí        try:
   142‚Üí            with open(temp_file, "rb") as f:
   143‚Üí                response = client.post(
   144‚Üí                    "/upload-and-analyze",
   145‚Üí                    files={"file": ("test.py", f, "text/plain")},
   146‚Üí                    data={"store_patterns": "true"},
   147‚Üí                )
   148‚Üí
   149‚Üí            assert response.status_code == 200
   150‚Üí            data = response.json()
   151‚Üí            assert "patterns_stored" in data
   152‚Üí            assert "issues_found" in data
   153‚Üí        finally:
   154‚Üí            Path(temp_file).unlink()
   155‚Üí

   505‚Üí    def test_verify_token(self):
   506‚Üí        """Test token verification endpoint."""
   507‚Üí        # First generate a token

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive API endpoint tests for src/backend/api/main.py.

Uses FastAPI TestClient for realistic testing of all endpoints:
- /analyze endpoint with various file types
- /generate-solution with different parameters  
- /review-code with various code samples
- Error scenarios (invalid inputs, timeouts)
- Authentication and validation paths
"""

import json
import tempfile
from pathlib import Path
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest
from fastapi.testclient import TestClient
from httpx import AsyncClient

from src.backend.api.main import app

# Mock the global agent
@pytest.fixture(autouse=True)
def mock_agent():
    """Mock the global agent for all API tests."""
    mock_agent_instance = AsyncMock()
    
    # Mock the analyze_file method
    mock_agent_instance.analyze_file.return_value = {
        "patterns": [],
        "issues": [],
        "suggestions": [],
        "quality_score": 0.8
    }
    
    # Mock the generate_solution method  
    mock_agent_instance.generate_solution.return_value = {
        "code": "def example(): pass",
        "confidence": 0.9,
        "explanation": "Generated example function"
    }
    
    # Mock other methods
    mock_agent_instance.review_code.return_value = {
        "score": 8,
        "issues": [],
        "suggestions": []
    }
    
    mock_agent_instance.refactor_code.return_value = {
        "refactored_code": "def refactored(): pass",
        "changes": []
    }
    
    with patch('src.backend.api.main.agent', mock_agent_instance):
        yield mock_agent_instance

# Test client for synchronous testing
client = TestClient(app)


class TestHealthEndpoints:
    """Test health and status endpoints."""

    def test_root_endpoint(self):
        """Test root endpoint."""
        response = client.get("/")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "message" in data
        assert "version" in data

    def test_health_check(self):
        """Test health check endpoint."""
        response = client.get("/health")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "status" in data
        assert "ollama_healthy" in data
        assert "qdrant_healthy" in data
        assert "agent_ready" in data

    def test_api_status(self):
        """Test API status endpoint."""
        response = client.get("/api/status")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "status" in data
        assert "uptime" in data


class TestAnalysisEndpoints:
    """Test code analysis endpoints."""

    def test_analyze_file_success(self):
        """Test successful file analysis."""
        with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w", suffix=".py", delete=False) as f:
            f.write("def test_function():\n    return 'test'")
            temp_file = f.name

        try:
            response = client.post(
                "/analyze", json={"file_path": temp_file, "store_patterns": True}
            )
            assert response.status_code == 200
            data = response.json()
            assert "patterns_stored" in data
            assert "issues_found" in data
            assert "complexity_score" in data
            assert "recommendations" in data
        finally:
            Path(temp_file).unlink()

    def test_analyze_file_not_found(self):
        """Test analysis with non-existent file."""
        response = client.post(
            "/analyze",
            json={"file_path": "/non/existent/file.py", "store_patterns": True},
        )
        assert response.status_code == 400  # API validation catches invalid paths

    def test_analyze_file_invalid_path(self):
        """Test analysis with invalid file path."""
        response = client.post(
            "/analyze",
            json={"file_path": "../../../etc/passwd", "store_patterns": True},
        )
        # Should be rejected for security reasons
        assert response.status_code in [400, 422, 500]

    def test_upload_and_analyze_success(self):
        """Test file upload and analysis."""
        test_code = "def test_function():\n    return 'test'"

        with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w", suffix=".py", delete=False) as f:
            f.write(test_code)
            temp_file = f.name

        try:
            with open(temp_file, "rb") as f:
                response = client.post(
                    "/upload-and-analyze",
                    files={"file": ("test.py", f, "text/plain")},
                    data={"store_patterns": "true"},
                )

            assert response.status_code == 200
            data = response.json()
            assert "patterns_stored" in data
            assert "issues_found" in data
        finally:
            Path(temp_file).unlink()

    def test_upload_and_analyze_invalid_file(self):
        """Test upload and analysis with invalid file."""
        response = client.post(
            "/upload-and-analyze",
            files={"file": ("test.txt", b"invalid content", "text/plain")},
            data={"store_patterns": "true"},
        )
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422, 500]


class TestGenerationEndpoints:
    """Test code generation endpoints."""

    def test_generate_solution_success(self):
        """Test successful solution generation."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-solution",
            json={
                "problem_description": "Create a function to add two numbers",
                "language": "python",
                "context": "Simple arithmetic function",
            },
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "success" in data
        assert "content" in data
        assert "patterns_used" in data
        assert "confidence" in data
        assert "metadata" in data

    def test_generate_solution_empty_description(self):
        """Test generation with empty problem description."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-solution", json={"problem_description": "", "language": "python"}
        )
        assert response.status_code in [400, 422]

    def test_generate_solution_unsupported_language(self):
        """Test generation with unsupported language."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-solution",
            json={
                "problem_description": "Test function",
                "language": "unsupported_lang",
            },
        )
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422, 500]

    def test_generate_endpoint_alias(self):
        """Test /generate endpoint (alias for generate-solution)."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate",
            json={"problem_description": "Test function", "language": "python"},
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "success" in data

    def test_generate_stream_success(self):
        """Test streaming generation endpoint."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-stream",
            json={
                "task": "Create a simple function",
                "language": "python",
                "extra_context": "Basic function",
                "ide_type": "vscode",
            },
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200
        # Should return streaming response
        assert response.headers.get("content-type", "").startswith("text/plain")

    def test_generate_stream_invalid_request(self):
        """Test streaming generation with invalid request."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-stream", json={"task": "", "language": "python"}  # Empty task
        )
        assert response.status_code in [400, 422]


class TestCodeReviewEndpoints:
    """Test code review endpoints."""

    def test_review_code_success(self):
        """Test successful code review."""
        test_code = """
def calculate_sum(a, b):
    return a + b
"""
        response = client.post(
            "/review-code", json={"code": test_code, "file_path": "test.py"}
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "success" in data
        assert "content" in data
        assert "patterns_used" in data
        assert "confidence" in data

    def test_review_code_empty(self):
        """Test code review with empty code."""
        response = client.post(
            "/review-code", json={"code": "", "file_path": "test.py"}
        )
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422]

    def test_review_code_malformed(self):
        """Test code review with malformed code."""
        response = client.post(
            "/review-code",
            json={
                "code": "def test(:\n    pass",  # Syntax error
                "file_path": "test.py",
            },
        )
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422, 500]


class TestRefactoringEndpoints:
    """Test code refactoring endpoints."""

    def test_refactor_code_success(self):
        """Test successful code refactoring."""
        test_code = """
def old_function(x):
    result = x * 2
    return result
"""
        response = client.post(
            "/refactor-code", json={"code": test_code, "refactor_type": "performance"}
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "success" in data
        assert "content" in data
        assert "patterns_used" in data
        assert "confidence" in data

    def test_refactor_code_invalid_type(self):
        """Test refactoring with invalid type."""
        response = client.post(
            "/refactor-code",
            json={"code": "def test(): pass", "refactor_type": "invalid_type"},
        )
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422, 500]

    def test_refactor_code_empty(self):
        """Test refactoring with empty code."""
        response = client.post(
            "/refactor-code", json={"code": "", "refactor_type": "general"}
        )
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422]


class TestFirstSpiritEndpoints:
    """Test FirstSpirit-specific endpoints."""

    def test_input_component_generation(self):
        """Test FirstSpirit input component generation."""
        response = client.post(
            "/firstspirit/input-component",
            json={
                "name": "TestInput",
                "type": "String",
                "language": "java",
                "description": "Test input component",
            },
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200

    def test_input_component_invalid_name(self):
        """Test input component with invalid name."""
        response = client.post(
            "/firstspirit/input-component",
            json={"name": "", "type": "String", "language": "java"},  # Empty name
        )
        assert response.status_code in [400, 422]


class TestIDEIntegrationEndpoints:
    """Test IDE integration endpoints."""

    def test_vscode_completion(self):
        """Test VSCode completion endpoint."""
        response = client.post(
            "/vscode/complete",
            json={
                "language": "python",
                "code": "def test_function():\n    ",
                "cursor_offset": 25,
                "imports": ["os"],
                "variables": ["x", "y"],
                "ide_type": "vscode",
            },
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "completions" in data

    def test_intellij_completion(self):
        """Test IntelliJ completion endpoint."""
        response = client.post(
            "/intellij/complete",
            json={
                "language": "java",
                "code": "public class Test {\n    public void method() {\n        ",
                "cursor_offset": 45,
                "imports": ["java.util.*"],
                "variables": ["value"],
                "ide_type": "intellij",
            },
        )

    def test_analyze_context(self):

            "/analyze-context",
            json={
                "file_path": "test.py",
                "language": "python",
                "code": "def test():\n    pass",

            },
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200

    def test_ide_info(self):
        """Test IDE info endpoint."""
        response = client.get("/ide-info")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "supported_ides" in data
        assert "features" in data


class TestMemoryEndpoints:
    """Test memory and learning endpoints."""

    def test_learn_pattern_success(self):

            "/learn",

                "before": "old code",
                "after": "new code",

class TestMetricsEndpoints:
    """Test metrics and monitoring endpoints."""

    def test_get_stats(self):

class TestAuthenticationEndpoints:
    """Test authentication endpoints."""

    def test_generate_token(self):

        response = client.post("/auth/token")

        data = response.json()
        assert "token" in data
        assert "expires_in" in data

    def test_verify_token(self):
        """Test token verification endpoint."""
        # First generate a token
        token_response = client.post("/auth/token")
        token = token_response.json()["token"]

        # Then verify it
        response = client.get(f"/auth/verify?token={token}")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert "valid" in data

        assert response.status_code == 200

class TestWebSocketEndpoints:
    """Test WebSocket endpoints."""

    def test_websocket_connection(self):

            # Send a test message
            websocket.send_text(json.dumps({"type": "ping"}))
            # Should receive a response

            assert data is not None

    def test_authenticated_websocket(self):
        """Test authenticated WebSocket connection."""
        # Generate a token first
        token_response = client.post("/auth/token")
        token = token_response.json()["token"]

        with client.websocket_connect(f"/ws/{token}") as websocket:
            # Send a test message
            websocket.send_text(
                json.dumps({"type": "subscribe", "metrics": ["memory"]})
            )
            # Should receive a response
            data = websocket.receive_text()
            assert data is not None


class TestErrorHandling:
    """Test error handling scenarios."""

    def test_invalid_json_payload(self):
        """Test handling of invalid JSON payload."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-solution",
            data="invalid json",
            headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"},
        )
        assert response.status_code == 422

    def test_missing_required_fields(self):
        """Test handling of missing required fields."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-solution",
            json={"language": "python"},  # Missing problem_description
        )
        assert response.status_code == 422

    def test_large_payload(self):
        """Test handling of large payload."""
        large_code = "def test():\n    pass\n" * 10000  # Very large code

        response = client.post(
            "/review-code", json={"code": large_code, "file_path": "test.py"}
        )
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 413, 422, 500]

    def test_rate_limiting(self):
        """Test rate limiting behavior."""
        # Make multiple rapid requests
        responses = []
        for _ in range(10):
            response = client.post(
                "/generate-solution",
                json={"problem_description": "Test function", "language": "python"},
            )
            responses.append(response.status_code)

        # Should handle gracefully (may have rate limiting)
        assert all(status in [200, 429, 500] for status in responses)


class TestEdgeCases:
    """Test edge cases and boundary conditions."""

    def test_empty_request_body(self):
        """Test handling of empty request body."""
        response = client.post("/generate-solution", data="")
        assert response.status_code in [400, 422]

    def test_unicode_content(self):
        """Test handling of Unicode content."""
        unicode_code = """
def test_function():
    return "Hello ‰∏ñÁïå üåç"
"""
        response = client.post(
            "/review-code", json={"code": unicode_code, "file_path": "test.py"}
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200

    def test_special_characters(self):
        """Test handling of special characters."""
        special_code = """
def test():
    # Test with special chars: !@#$%^&*()_+-=[]{}|;':",./<>?
    return "test"
"""
        response = client.post(
            "/review-code", json={"code": special_code, "file_path": "test.py"}
        )
        assert response.status_code == 200

    def test_concurrent_requests(self):
        """Test handling of concurrent requests."""
        import threading
        import time

        results = []

        def make_request():
            response = client.post(
                "/generate-solution",
                json={"problem_description": "Concurrent test", "language": "python"},
            )
            results.append(response.status_code)

        # Start multiple threads
        threads = []
        for _ in range(5):
            thread = threading.Thread(target=make_request)
            threads.append(thread)
            thread.start()

        # Wait for all threads to complete
        for thread in threads:
            thread.join()

        # All requests should be handled
        assert len(results) == 5
        assert all(status in [200, 429, 500] for status in results)


class TestValidation:
    """Test input validation."""

    def test_language_validation(self):
        """Test language field validation."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate-solution",
            json={"problem_description": "Test", "language": "invalid_language"},
        )
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422, 500]

    def test_file_path_validation(self):
        """Test file path validation."""
        response = client.post(
            "/analyze",
            json={
                "file_path": "invalid/path/with/../traversal",
                "store_patterns": True,
            },
        )
        # Should reject path traversal attempts
        assert response.status_code in [400, 422, 500]

    def test_code_content_validation(self):
        """Test code content validation."""
        malicious_code = """
import os
os.system('rm -rf /')  # Malicious code
"""
        response = client.post(
            "/review-code", json={"code": malicious_code, "file_path": "test.py"}
        )
        # Should handle safely
        assert response.status_code in [200, 400, 422, 500]


if __name__ == "__main__":
    pytest.main([__file__, "-v"])

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/api.py.

Tests all endpoints, error handling, and integration scenarios.
"""

import json
import tempfile
from pathlib import Path
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest
from fastapi.testclient import TestClient

from src.api import app, GenerateRequest, LearnRequest, FirstSpiritComponentRequest


@pytest.fixture
def mock_agent():
    """Mock LocalCodeAgent for testing."""
    agent = AsyncMock()
    
    # Mock process_code method
    agent.process_code.return_value = {
        "result": Mock(
            success=True,
            generated_code="def test_function():\n    return 'test'",
            confidence=0.9,
            metadata={"patterns_used": 2, "quality_score": 0.8}
        ),
        "improvement_score": 0.85,
        "attempts": [
            {"attempt": 1, "success": True, "confidence": 0.9}
        ]
    }
    
    # Mock memory methods
    agent.memory.store_successful_pattern.return_value = "pattern_123"
    agent.memory.get_statistics.return_value = {
        "total_patterns": 100,
        "total_failed_patterns": 10,
        "language_distribution": {"java": 60, "python": 40},
        "task_type_distribution": {"input-component": 30, "output-channel": 20},
        "quality_stats": {"average": 0.8, "min": 0.5, "max": 1.0}
    }
    
    # Mock code generator
    agent.code_generator.ollama_client.health_check.return_value = True
    agent.code_generator.ollama_client.list_models.return_value = [
        {"name": "codellama:13b-instruct"}
    ]
    
    return agent


@pytest.fixture
def client(mock_agent):
    """Test client with mocked agent."""
    with patch('src.api.agent', mock_agent):
        yield TestClient(app)


class TestHealthEndpoints:
    """Test health and status endpoints."""
    
    def test_root_endpoint(self, client):
        """Test root endpoint."""
        response = client.get("/")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["message"] == "FirstSpirit Local Agent API"
        assert data["version"] == "1.0.0"
    
    def test_health_check_with_agent(self, client):
        """Test health check with working agent."""
        response = client.get("/health")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["status"] == "healthy"
        assert data["ollama_healthy"] is True
        assert data["model_available"] is True
        assert data["memory_healthy"] is True
        assert data["agent_ready"] is True
    
    def test_health_check_without_agent(self):
        """Test health check without initialized agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.get("/health")
            assert response.status_code == 200
            data = response.json()
            assert data["status"] == "unhealthy"
            assert data["agent_ready"] is False


class TestGenerateEndpoints:
    """Test code generation endpoints."""
    
    def test_generate_code_success(self, client):
        """Test successful code generation."""
        request_data = {
            "task": "input-component",
            "language": "java",
            "extra_context": "Simple string input",
            "max_attempts": 2
        }
        
        response = client.post("/generate", json=request_data)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["success"] is True
        assert "generated_code" in data
        assert data["confidence"] == 0.9
        assert "improvement_score" in data
        assert "attempts" in data
        assert "metadata" in data
    
    def test_generate_code_without_agent(self):
        """Test generation without initialized agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.post("/generate", json={
                "task": "test",
                "language": "java"
            })
            assert response.status_code == 503
            assert "Agent not initialized" in response.json()["detail"]
    
    def test_generate_code_agent_failure(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test generation when agent fails."""
        mock_agent.process_code.return_value = {"result": None}
        
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Failed to generate code" in response.json()["detail"]
    
    def test_generate_code_invalid_request(self, client):
        """Test generation with invalid request."""
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "language": "java"  # Missing required task field
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_generate_code_agent_exception(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test generation when agent raises exception."""
        mock_agent.process_code.side_effect = Exception("Test error")
        
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Test error" in response.json()["detail"]


class TestLearnEndpoints:
    """Test pattern learning endpoints."""
    
    def test_learn_pattern_success(self, client):
        """Test successful pattern learning."""
        request_data = {
            "before": "old code",
            "after": "new code",
            "task": "refactor",
            "language": "java",
            "quality_score": 0.9,
            "metadata": {"test": "value"}
        }
        
        response = client.post("/learn", json=request_data)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["success"] is True
        assert data["pattern_id"] == "pattern_123"
        assert "Pattern stored successfully" in data["message"]
    
    def test_learn_pattern_without_agent(self):
        """Test learning without initialized agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.post("/learn", json={
                "before": "old",
                "after": "new",
                "task": "test",
                "language": "java"
            })
            assert response.status_code == 503
    
    def test_learn_pattern_exception(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test learning when memory raises exception."""
        mock_agent.memory.store_successful_pattern.side_effect = Exception("Memory error")
        
        response = client.post("/learn", json={
            "before": "old",
            "after": "new",
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Memory error" in response.json()["detail"]


class TestMemoryEndpoints:
    """Test memory statistics endpoints."""
    
    def test_memory_stats_success(self, client):
        """Test successful memory statistics retrieval."""
        response = client.get("/memory/stats")
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["total_patterns"] == 100
        assert data["total_failed_patterns"] == 10
        assert "language_distribution" in data
        assert "task_type_distribution" in data
        assert "quality_stats" in data
    
    def test_memory_stats_without_agent(self):
        """Test memory stats without initialized agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.get("/memory/stats")
            assert response.status_code == 503
    
    def test_memory_stats_exception(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test memory stats when agent raises exception."""
        mock_agent.memory.get_statistics.side_effect = Exception("Stats error")
        
        response = client.get("/memory/stats")
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Stats error" in response.json()["detail"]


class TestFirstSpiritEndpoints:
    """Test FirstSpirit-specific endpoints."""
    
    def test_input_component_success(self, client):
        """Test successful input component generation."""
        request_data = {
            "name": "TestInput",
            "type": "String",
            "language": "java",
            "extra_context": "Test component"
        }
        
        response = client.post("/firstspirit/input-component", json=request_data)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["success"] is True
        assert "generated_code" in data
        assert data["confidence"] == 0.9
    
    def test_input_component_without_agent(self):
        """Test input component generation without agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.post("/firstspirit/input-component", json={
                "name": "Test",
                "type": "String",
                "language": "java"
            })
            assert response.status_code == 503
    
    def test_input_component_failure(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test input component generation failure."""
        mock_agent.process_code.return_value = {"result": None}
        
        response = client.post("/firstspirit/input-component", json={
            "name": "Test",
            "type": "String",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Failed to generate input component" in response.json()["detail"]
    
    def test_output_channel_success(self, client):
        """Test successful output channel generation."""
        request_data = {
            "name": "TestOutput",
            "language": "java",
            "extra_context": "Test channel"
        }
        
        response = client.post("/firstspirit/output-channel", json=request_data)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["success"] is True
        assert "generated_code" in data
        assert data["confidence"] == 0.9
    
    def test_output_channel_without_agent(self):
        """Test output channel generation without agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.post("/firstspirit/output-channel", json={
                "name": "Test",
                "language": "java"
            })
            assert response.status_code == 503
    
    def test_output_channel_failure(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test output channel generation failure."""
        mock_agent.process_code.return_value = {"result": None}
        
        response = client.post("/firstspirit/output-channel", json={
            "name": "Test",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Failed to generate output channel" in response.json()["detail"]


class TestRequestValidation:
    """Test request validation and error handling."""
    
    def test_generate_request_validation(self, client):
        """Test GenerateRequest validation."""
        # Missing required task field
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
        
        # Invalid max_attempts
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java",
            "max_attempts": -1
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_learn_request_validation(self, client):
        """Test LearnRequest validation."""
        # Missing required fields
        response = client.post("/learn", json={
            "before": "old"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
        
        # Invalid quality_score
        response = client.post("/learn", json={
            "before": "old",
            "after": "new",
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java",
            "quality_score": 1.5  # Should be 0.0-1.0
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_firstspirit_request_validation(self, client):
        """Test FirstSpiritComponentRequest validation."""
        # Missing required name field
        response = client.post("/firstspirit/input-component", json={
            "type": "String",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422


class TestErrorHandling:
    """Test error handling scenarios."""
    
    def test_invalid_json(self, client):
        """Test handling of invalid JSON."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate",
            data="invalid json",
            headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}
        )
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_empty_request_body(self, client):
        """Test handling of empty request body."""
        response = client.post("/generate", json={})
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_large_payload(self, client):
        """Test handling of large payload."""
        large_context = "A" * 100000  # 100KB context
        
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java",
            "extra_context": large_context
        })
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 413, 422, 500]
    
    def test_unicode_content(self, client):
        """Test handling of Unicode content."""
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test function with unicode: ÊµãËØï üéâ",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 200


class TestCORS:
    """Test CORS middleware."""
    
    def test_cors_headers(self, client):
        """Test CORS headers are present."""
        response = client.options("/", headers={
            "Origin": "http://localhost:3000",
            "Access-Control-Request-Method": "POST"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 200
        assert "access-control-allow-origin" in response.headers
        assert "access-control-allow-methods" in response.headers


class TestStartupShutdown:
    """Test startup and shutdown events."""
    
    def test_startup_event_success(self):
        """Test successful startup event."""
        with patch('src.api.Memory'), \
             patch('src.api.OllamaClient'), \
             patch('src.api.CodeGenerator'), \
             patch('src.api.LocalCodeAgent') as mock_agent_class:
            
            mock_agent_instance = Mock()
            mock_agent_class.return_value = mock_agent_instance
            
            # Create new app instance to trigger startup
            from src.api import app
            client = TestClient(app)
            
            # Agent should be initialized
            assert mock_agent_class.called
    
    def test_startup_event_failure(self):
        """Test startup event failure."""
        with patch('src.api.Memory', side_effect=Exception("Memory init failed")):
            # Should raise exception during startup
            with pytest.raises(Exception, match="Memory init failed"):
                TestClient(app)


class TestModelClasses:
    """Test Pydantic model classes."""
    
    def test_generate_request_model(self):
        """Test GenerateRequest model."""
        # Valid request
        request = GenerateRequest(
            task="input-component",
            language="java",
            extra_context="test context",
            max_attempts=3
        )
        assert request.task == "input-component"
        assert request.language == "java"
        assert request.max_attempts == 3
        
        # Default values
        request = GenerateRequest(task="test")
        assert request.language == "java"
        assert request.max_attempts == 2
    
    def test_learn_request_model(self):
        """Test LearnRequest model."""
        request = LearnRequest(
            before="old code",
            after="new code",
            task="refactor",
            language="java",
            quality_score=0.8,
            metadata={"key": "value"}
        )
        assert request.before == "old code"
        assert request.after == "new code"
        assert request.quality_score == 0.8
        
        # Default values
        request = LearnRequest(
            before="old",
            after="new",
            task="test"
        )
        assert request.language == "java"
        assert request.quality_score == 1.0
    
    def test_firstspirit_component_request_model(self):
        """Test FirstSpiritComponentRequest model."""
        request = FirstSpiritComponentRequest(
            name="TestComponent",
            type="String",
            language="java",
            extra_context="test"
        )
        assert request.name == "TestComponent"
        assert request.type == "String"
        
        # Default values
        request = FirstSpiritComponentRequest(name="Test")
        assert request.type == "String"
        assert request.language == "java"


if __name__ == "__main__":
    pytest.main([__file__, "-v"])

    def test_learn_pattern_success(self, client):
        """Test successful pattern learning."""
        request_data = {
            "before": "old code",
            "after": "new code",
            "task": "refactor",
            "language": "java",
            "quality_score": 0.9,
            "metadata": {"test": "value"}
        }
        
        response = client.post("/learn", json=request_data)
        assert response.status_code == 200
        data = response.json()
        assert data["success"] is True
        assert data["pattern_id"] == "pattern_123"
        assert "Pattern stored successfully" in data["message"]
    
    def test_learn_pattern_without_agent(self):
        """Test learning without initialized agent."""
        with patch('src.api.agent', None):
            client = TestClient(app)
            response = client.post("/learn", json={
                "before": "old",
                "after": "new",
                "task": "test",
                "language": "java"
            })
            assert response.status_code == 503
    
    def test_learn_pattern_exception(self, client, mock_agent):
        """Test learning when memory raises exception."""
        mock_agent.memory.store_successful_pattern.side_effect = Exception("Memory error")
        
        response = client.post("/learn", json={
            "before": "old",
            "after": "new",
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 500
        assert "Memory error" in response.json()["detail"]

class TestRequestValidation:
    """Test request validation and error handling."""
    
    def test_generate_request_validation(self, client):
        """Test GenerateRequest validation."""
        # Missing required task field
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
        
        # Invalid max_attempts
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java",
            "max_attempts": -1
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_learn_request_validation(self, client):
        """Test LearnRequest validation."""
        # Missing required fields
        response = client.post("/learn", json={
            "before": "old"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
        
        # Invalid quality_score
        response = client.post("/learn", json={
            "before": "old",
            "after": "new",
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java",
            "quality_score": 1.5  # Should be 0.0-1.0
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_firstspirit_request_validation(self, client):
        """Test FirstSpiritComponentRequest validation."""
        # Missing required name field
        response = client.post("/firstspirit/input-component", json={
            "type": "String",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 422


class TestErrorHandling:
    """Test error handling scenarios."""
    
    def test_invalid_json(self, client):
        """Test handling of invalid JSON."""
        response = client.post(
            "/generate",
            data="invalid json",
            headers={"Content-Type": "application/json"}
        )
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_empty_request_body(self, client):
        """Test handling of empty request body."""
        response = client.post("/generate", json={})
        assert response.status_code == 422
    
    def test_large_payload(self, client):
        """Test handling of large payload."""
        large_context = "A" * 100000  # 100KB context
        
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test",
            "language": "java",
            "extra_context": large_context
        })
        # Should handle gracefully
        assert response.status_code in [200, 413, 422, 500]
    
    def test_unicode_content(self, client):
        """Test handling of Unicode content."""
        response = client.post("/generate", json={
            "task": "test function with unicode: ÊµãËØï üéâ",
            "language": "java"
        })
        assert response.status_code == 200


class TestCORS:
    """Test CORS middleware."""
    
    def test_cors_headers(self, client):

        })
        assert response.status_code == 200

        assert "access-control-allow-methods" in response.headers


class TestStartupShutdown:
    """Test startup and shutdown events."""
    
    def test_startup_event_success(self):
        """Test successful startup event."""
        with patch('src.api.Memory'), \
             patch('src.api.OllamaClient'), \
             patch('src.api.CodeGenerator'), \
             patch('src.api.LocalCodeAgent') as mock_agent_class:
            
            mock_agent_instance = Mock()
            mock_agent_class.return_value = mock_agent_instance
            
            # Create new app instance to trigger startup
            from src.api import app
            client = TestClient(app)
            
            # Agent should be initialized
            assert mock_agent_class.called
    
    def test_startup_event_failure(self):
        """Test startup event failure."""
        with patch('src.api.Memory', side_effect=Exception("Memory init failed")):
            # Should raise exception during startup
            with pytest.raises(Exception, match="Memory init failed"):
                TestClient(app)


class TestModelClasses:
    """Test Pydantic model classes."""
    
    def test_generate_request_model(self):
        """Test GenerateRequest model."""
        # Valid request
        request = GenerateRequest(
            task="input-component",
            language="java",
            extra_context="test context",
            max_attempts=3
        )
        assert request.task == "input-component"
        assert request.language == "java"
        assert request.max_attempts == 3
        
        # Default values
        request = GenerateRequest(task="test")
        assert request.language == "java"
        assert request.max_attempts == 2
    
    def test_learn_request_model(self):
        """Test LearnRequest model."""
        request = LearnRequest(
            before="old code",
            after="new code",
            task="refactor",
            language="java",
            quality_score=0.8,
            metadata={"key": "value"}
        )
        assert request.before == "old code"
        assert request.after == "new code"
        assert request.quality_score == 0.8
        
        # Default values
        request = LearnRequest(
            before="old",
            after="new",
            task="test"
        )
        assert request.language == "java"
        assert request.quality_score == 1.0
    
    def test_firstspirit_component_request_model(self):
        """Test FirstSpiritComponentRequest model."""
        request = FirstSpiritComponentRequest(
            name="TestComponent",
            type="String",
            language="java",
            extra_context="test"
        )
        assert request.name == "TestComponent"
        assert request.type == "String"
        
        # Default values
        request = FirstSpiritComponentRequest(name="Test")
        assert request.type == "String"
        assert request.language == "java"


if __name__ == "__main__":
    pytest.main([__file__, "-v"])
