1‚Üí"""
     2‚ÜíCode Generator optimized for RX 7900 XT with Ollama integration.
     3‚Üí
     4‚ÜíThis module provides intelligent code generation capabilities with
     5‚Üímemory management optimized for 20GB VRAM and ROCm 6.3 acceleration.
     6‚Üí"""
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíimport asyncio
     9‚Üíimport logging
    10‚Üíimport re
    11‚Üíimport time
    12‚Üífrom dataclasses import dataclass
    13‚Üífrom enum import Enum
    14‚Üífrom typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üíimport psutil
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üítry:
    19‚Üí    import GPUtil
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí    GPUTIL_AVAILABLE = True
    22‚Üíexcept ImportError:
    23‚Üí    GPUTIL_AVAILABLE = False
    24‚Üí    print("Warning: GPUtil not available. GPU monitoring will be limited.")
    25‚Üí
    26‚Üífrom backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaClient, OllamaResponse
    27‚Üífrom memory import Memory
    28‚Üífrom src.constants import TEST_FS_MEMORY_DB
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üílogger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí# Add this constant at the top of the file (after imports)
    33‚ÜíGENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS = (
    34‚Üí    "Generate only the code without explanations. Ensure the code is:\n"
    35‚Üí    "- Well-structured and readable\n"
    36‚Üí    "- Follows best practices\n"
    37‚Üí    "- Includes proper error handling\n"
    38‚Üí    "- Has appropriate documentation\n\n"
    39‚Üí    "Code:"
    40‚Üí)
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üíclass GenerationType(Enum):
    44‚Üí    """Types of code generation tasks."""
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí    FUNCTION = "function"
    47‚Üí    CLASS = "class"
    48‚Üí    MODULE = "module"
    49‚Üí    REFACTOR = "refactor"
    50‚Üí    TEST = "test"
    51‚Üí    DOCUMENTATION = "documentation"
    52‚Üí    BUGFIX = "bugfix"
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üíclass MemoryStatus(Enum):
    56‚Üí    """Memory status for GPU operations."""
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí    OK = "ok"
    59‚Üí    WARNING = "warning"
    60‚Üí    CRITICAL = "critical"
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí@dataclass
    64‚Üíclass GenerationRequest:
    65‚Üí    """Request for code generation."""
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí    prompt: str
    68‚Üí    generation_type: GenerationType
    69‚Üí    language: str = "python"
    70‚Üí    context: Optional[str] = None
    71‚Üí    constraints: Optional[List[str]] = None
    72‚Üí    max_tokens: Optional[int] = None
    73‚Üí    temperature: Optional[float] = None
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí@dataclass
    77‚Üíclass GenerationResponse:
    78‚Üí    """Response from code generation."""
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí    success: bool
    81‚Üí    generated_code: str
    82‚Üí    confidence: float
    83‚Üí    generation_time: float
    84‚Üí    tokens_used: int
    85‚Üí    memory_usage: Dict[str, Any]
    86‚Üí    warnings: List[str]
    87‚Üí    metadata: Dict[str, Any]
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üíclass CodeGenerator:
    91‚Üí    """An intelligent code generator optimized for local hardware, especially GPUs.
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí    This class manages the entire code generation lifecycle, from prompt
    94‚Üí    optimization and memory monitoring to generation with fallback strategies
    95‚Üí    and post-processing. It is specifically tuned for use with Ollama and
    96‚Üí    can be configured for different hardware profiles (e.g., RX 7900 XT).
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí    Attributes:
    99‚Üí        ollama_client (OllamaClient): The client for interacting with the Ollama service.
   100‚Üí        memory_db (Optional[Memory]): The memory system for learning from past generations.
   101‚Üí        model_name (str): The primary model used for code generation.
   102‚Üí        embedding_model (str): The model used for creating embeddings.
   103‚Üí        default_options (Dict[str, Any]): Default parameters for the generation model.
   104‚Üí        memory_thresholds (Dict[str, Any]): Thresholds for VRAM usage to trigger warnings or fallbacks.
   105‚Üí        generation_stats (Dict[str, Any]): A dictionary for tracking performance metrics.
   106‚Üí    """
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí    def __init__(
   109‚Üí        self,
   110‚Üí        ollama_client: OllamaClient,
   111‚Üí        memory_db: Optional[Memory] = None,
   112‚Üí        model_name: str = "llama2",
   113‚Üí        embedding_model: str = "nomic-embed-text",
   114‚Üí    ) -> None:
   115‚Üí        """
   116‚Üí        Initialize the Code Generator.
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí        Args:
   119‚Üí            ollama_client: Ollama client instance
   120‚Üí            memory_db: Memory database for pattern learning
   121‚Üí            model_name: Model to use for generation
   122‚Üí            embedding_model: Model to use for embeddings
   123‚Üí        """
   124‚Üí        self.ollama_client = ollama_client
   125‚Üí        self.memory_db = memory_db
   126‚Üí        self.model_name = model_name
   127‚Üí        self.embedding_model = embedding_model
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí        # RX 7900 XT optimized settings for codellama:13b-instruct
   130‚Üí        self.default_options = {
   131‚Üí            "temperature": 0.1,
   132‚Üí            "num_predict": 4096,  # Increased for 20GB VRAM
   133‚Üí            "num_ctx": 8192,  # Larger context window
   134‚Üí            "num_gpu": 35,  # More GPU layers for ROCm 6.3
   135‚Üí            "num_thread": 8,  # More CPU threads as backup
   136‚Üí        }
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí        # Memory thresholds for RX 7900 XT (20GB VRAM)
   139‚Üí        self.memory_thresholds = {
   140‚Üí            "warning": 16.0,  # GB
   141‚Üí            "critical": 18.0,  # GB
   142‚Üí            "max_ctx": 8192,  # Maximum context tokens
   143‚Üí            "max_tokens": 4096,  # Maximum generation tokens
   144‚Üí        }
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí        # Performance tracking
   147‚Üí        self.generation_stats = {
   148‚Üí            "total_generations": 0,
   149‚Üí            "successful_generations": 0,
   150‚Üí            "failed_generations": 0,
   151‚Üí            "avg_generation_time": 0.0,
   152‚Üí            "memory_warnings": 0,
   153‚Üí        }
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí    async def generate_code(self, request: GenerationRequest) -> GenerationResponse:
   156‚Üí        """
   157‚Üí        Generate code based on the request.
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí        Args:
   160‚Üí            request: Generation request with prompt and parameters
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí        Returns:
   163‚Üí            GenerationResponse with results and metadata
   164‚Üí        """
   165‚Üí        start_time = time.time()
   166‚Üí        warnings = []
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí        try:
   169‚Üí            # Check memory status before generation
   170‚Üí            memory_status = await self._check_memory_status()
   171‚Üí            if memory_status == MemoryStatus.CRITICAL:
   172‚Üí                return GenerationResponse(
   173‚Üí                    success=False,
   174‚Üí                    generated_code="",
   175‚Üí                    confidence=0.0,
   176‚Üí                    generation_time=time.time() - start_time,
   177‚Üí                    tokens_used=0,
   178‚Üí                    memory_usage=self._get_memory_usage(),
   179‚Üí                    warnings=["Critical memory usage - generation aborted"],
   180‚Üí                    metadata={"error": "insufficient_memory"},
   181‚Üí                )
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí            if memory_status == MemoryStatus.WARNING:
   184‚Üí                warnings.append("High memory usage detected")
   185‚Üí                self.generation_stats["memory_warnings"] += 1
   186‚Üí
   187‚Üí            # Build optimized prompt
   188‚Üí            prompt = await self._build_optimized_prompt(request)
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí            # Adjust generation parameters based on memory status
   191‚Üí            options = self._get_optimized_options(request, memory_status)
   192‚Üí
   193‚Üí            # Generate code
   194‚Üí            response = await self._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí            # Post-process generated code
   197‚Üí            processed_code = self._post_process_code(response.content, request.language)
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üí            # Calculate confidence
   200‚Üí            confidence = self._calculate_confidence(response, request)
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí            # Update statistics
   203‚Üí            generation_time = time.time() - start_time
   204‚Üí            self._update_stats(True, generation_time)
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üí            # Store successful pattern if memory database is available
   207‚Üí            if self.memory_db and response.content.strip():
   208‚Üí                await self._store_successful_pattern(
   209‚Üí                    request, processed_code, confidence
   210‚Üí                )
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí            return GenerationResponse(
   213‚Üí                success=True,
   214‚Üí                generated_code=processed_code,
   215‚Üí                confidence=confidence,
   216‚Üí                generation_time=generation_time,
   217‚Üí                tokens_used=self._estimate_tokens(response.content),
   218‚Üí                memory_usage=self._get_memory_usage(),
   219‚Üí                warnings=warnings,
   220‚Üí                metadata={
   221‚Üí                    "model_used": self.model_name,
   222‚Üí                    "generation_type": request.generation_type.value,
   223‚Üí                    "memory_status": memory_status.value,
   224‚Üí                },
   225‚Üí            )
   226‚Üí
   227‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   228‚Üí            logger.error(f"Code generation failed: {e}")
   229‚Üí
   230‚Üí            # Store failed pattern if memory database is available
   231‚Üí            if self.memory_db:
   232‚Üí                await self._store_failed_pattern(request, str(e))
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí            generation_time = time.time() - start_time
   235‚Üí            self._update_stats(False, generation_time)
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí            return GenerationResponse(
   238‚Üí                success=False,
   239‚Üí                generated_code="",
   240‚Üí                confidence=0.0,
   241‚Üí                generation_time=generation_time,
   242‚Üí                tokens_used=0,
   243‚Üí                memory_usage=self._get_memory_usage(),
   244‚Üí                warnings=[f"Generation failed: {str(e)}"],
   245‚Üí                metadata={"error": str(e)},
   246‚Üí            )
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí    async def _check_memory_status(self) -> MemoryStatus:
   249‚Üí        """
   250‚Üí        Check current memory usage and return status.
   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí        Returns:
   253‚Üí            MemoryStatus indicating current memory state
   254‚Üí        """
   255‚Üí        try:
   256‚Üí            # Check GPU memory first if available
   257‚Üí            if GPUTIL_AVAILABLE:
   258‚Üí                gpu_status = self._check_gpu_memory_status()
   259‚Üí                if gpu_status is not None:
   260‚Üí                    return gpu_status
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí            # Fallback to system memory check
   263‚Üí            return self._check_system_memory_status()
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   266‚Üí            logger.warning(f"Memory check failed: {e}")
   267‚Üí            return MemoryStatus.OK  # Assume OK if check fails
   268‚Üí
   269‚Üí    def _check_gpu_memory_status(self) -> Optional[MemoryStatus]:
   270‚Üí        """Check GPU memory status and return MemoryStatus if available."""
   271‚Üí        try:
   272‚Üí            gpus = GPUtil.getGPUs()
   273‚Üí            if not gpus:
   274‚Üí                return None
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí            gpu = gpus[0]  # Assume first GPU
   277‚Üí            gpu_memory_used = gpu.memoryUsed
   278‚Üí            gpu_memory_gb = gpu_memory_used / 1024
   279‚Üí
   280‚Üí            return self._get_memory_status_from_gb(gpu_memory_gb)
   281‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   282‚Üí            logger.warning(f"GPU memory check failed: {e}")
   283‚Üí            return None
   284‚Üí
   285‚Üí    def _check_system_memory_status(self) -> MemoryStatus:
   286‚Üí        """Check system memory status."""
   287‚Üí        system_memory = psutil.virtual_memory()
   288‚Üí        memory_gb = system_memory.used / (1024**3)
   289‚Üí        return self._get_memory_status_from_gb(memory_gb)
   290‚Üí
   291‚Üí    def _get_memory_status_from_gb(self, memory_gb: float) -> MemoryStatus:
   292‚Üí        """Get memory status based on memory usage in GB."""
   293‚Üí        if memory_gb >= self.memory_thresholds["critical"]:
   294‚Üí            return MemoryStatus.CRITICAL
   295‚Üí        elif memory_gb >= self.memory_thresholds["warning"]:
   296‚Üí            return MemoryStatus.WARNING
   297‚Üí        else:
   298‚Üí            return MemoryStatus.OK
   299‚Üí
   300‚Üí    def _get_memory_usage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   301‚Üí        """
   302‚Üí        Get current memory usage statistics.
   303‚Üí
   304‚Üí        Returns:
   305‚Üí            Dictionary with memory usage information
   306‚Üí        """
   307‚Üí        try:
   308‚Üí            # System memory
   309‚Üí            system_memory = psutil.virtual_memory()
   310‚Üí
   311‚Üí            # GPU memory if available
   312‚Üí            gpu_info = self._get_gpu_memory_info()
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí            return {
   315‚Üí                "system_memory_used_gb": system_memory.used / (1024**3),
   316‚Üí                "system_memory_total_gb": system_memory.total / (1024**3),
   317‚Üí                "system_memory_percent": system_memory.percent,
   318‚Üí                "gpu_memory": gpu_info,
   319‚Üí            }
   320‚Üí
   321‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   322‚Üí            logger.error(f"Memory usage check failed: {e}")
   323‚Üí            return {"error": str(e)}
   324‚Üí
   325‚Üí    def _get_gpu_memory_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   326‚Üí        """Get GPU memory information if available."""
   327‚Üí        try:
   328‚Üí            if not GPUTIL_AVAILABLE:
   329‚Üí                return {}
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí            gpus = GPUtil.getGPUs()
   332‚Üí            if not gpus:
   333‚Üí                return {}
   334‚Üí
   335‚Üí            gpu = gpus[0]
   336‚Üí            return {
   337‚Üí                "gpu_memory_used_gb": gpu.memoryUsed / 1024,
   338‚Üí                "gpu_memory_total_gb": gpu.memoryTotal / 1024,
   339‚Üí                "gpu_memory_percent": (gpu.memoryUsed / gpu.memoryTotal) * 100,
   340‚Üí            }
   341‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   342‚Üí            logger.warning(f"GPU memory check failed: {e}")
   343‚Üí            return {}
   344‚Üí
   345‚Üí    async def _build_optimized_prompt(self, request: GenerationRequest) -> str:
   346‚Üí        """
   347‚Üí        Build an optimized prompt for code generation.
   348‚Üí
   349‚Üí        Args:
   350‚Üí            request: Generation request
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí        Returns:
   353‚Üí            Optimized prompt string
   354‚Üí        """
   355‚Üí        # Base prompt template
   356‚Üí        expert_intro = f"You are an expert {
   357‚Üí            request.language} developer. Generate clean, professional code."
   358‚Üí        task_info = (
   359‚Üí            f"Task: {request.generation_type.value}\nLanguage: {request.language}"
   360‚Üí        )
   361‚Üí        requirements_section = f"Requirements:\n{request.prompt}"
   362‚Üí
   363‚Üí        base_prompt = f"{expert_intro}\n\n{task_info}\n\n{requirements_section}\n\n"
   364‚Üí
   365‚Üí        # Add context if provided
   366‚Üí        if request.context:
   367‚Üí            base_prompt += f"Context:\n{request.context}\n\n"
   368‚Üí
   369‚Üí        # Add constraints if provided
   370‚Üí        if request.constraints:
   371‚Üí            base_prompt += "Constraints:\n"
   372‚Üí            for constraint in request.constraints:
   373‚Üí                base_prompt += f"- {constraint}\n"
   374‚Üí            base_prompt += "\n"
   375‚Üí
   376‚Üí        # Add similar patterns from memory if available
   377‚Üí        if self.memory_db:
   378‚Üí            try:
   379‚Üí                similar_patterns = self.memory_db.get_similar_patterns(
   380‚Üí                    request.generation_type.value,
   381‚Üí                    language=request.language,
   382‚Üí                    limit=3,
   383‚Üí                )
   384‚Üí
   385‚Üí                if similar_patterns:
   386‚Üí                    base_prompt += "Similar patterns found:\n"
   387‚Üí                    for pattern in similar_patterns[
   388‚Üí                        :2
   389‚Üí                    ]:  # Limit to 2 patterns to save context
   390‚Üí                        base_prompt += f"Pattern: {pattern['after_code']}\n"
   391‚Üí                    base_prompt += "\n"
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí            except Exception as e:
   394‚Üí                logger.warning(f"Failed to retrieve similar patterns: {e}")
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí        # Add generation instructions
   397‚Üí        base_prompt += GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS
   398‚Üí
   399‚Üí        return base_prompt
   400‚Üí
   401‚Üí    def _get_optimized_options(
   402‚Üí        self, request: GenerationRequest, memory_status: MemoryStatus
   403‚Üí    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   404‚Üí        """
   405‚Üí        Get optimized generation options based on memory status.
   406‚Üí
   407‚Üí        Args:
   408‚Üí            request: Generation request
   409‚Üí            memory_status: Current memory status
   410‚Üí
   411‚Üí        Returns:
   412‚Üí            Optimized options dictionary
   413‚Üí        """
   414‚Üí        options = self.default_options.copy()
   415‚Üí
   416‚Üí        # Override with request parameters if provided
   417‚Üí        if request.temperature is not None:
   418‚Üí            options["temperature"] = request.temperature
   419‚Üí
   420‚Üí        if request.max_tokens is not None:
   421‚Üí            options["num_predict"] = min(
   422‚Üí                request.max_tokens, self.memory_thresholds["max_tokens"]
   423‚Üí            )
   424‚Üí
   425‚Üí        # Adjust based on memory status
   426‚Üí        if memory_status == MemoryStatus.WARNING:
   427‚Üí            options["num_predict"] = min(options["num_predict"], 512)
   428‚Üí            options["num_ctx"] = min(options["num_ctx"], 1024)
   429‚Üí            options["num_gpu"] = 0  # Fallback to CPU
   430‚Üí            options["num_thread"] = 2
   431‚Üí
   432‚Üí        elif memory_status == MemoryStatus.CRITICAL:
   433‚Üí            options["num_predict"] = 256
   434‚Üí            options["num_ctx"] = 512
   435‚Üí            options["num_gpu"] = 0  # Force CPU
   436‚Üí            options["num_thread"] = 1
   437‚Üí
   438‚Üí        return options
   439‚Üí
   440‚Üí    async def _generate_with_fallback(
   441‚Üí        self, prompt: str, options: Dict[str, Any]
   442‚Üí    ) -> OllamaResponse:
   443‚Üí        """
   444‚Üí        Generate code with fallback strategies.
   445‚Üí
   446‚Üí        Args:
   447‚Üí            prompt: Optimized prompt
   448‚Üí            options: Generation options
   449‚Üí
   450‚Üí        Returns:
   451‚Üí            OllamaResponse with generated content
   452‚Üí        """
   453‚Üí        max_retries = 3
   454‚Üí        last_error = None
   455‚Üí
   456‚Üí        for attempt in range(max_retries):
   457‚Üí            try:
   458‚Üí                # Try with current options
   459‚Üí                response = await self.ollama_client.generate_completion(
   460‚Üí                    prompt=prompt,
   461‚Üí                    model=self.model_name,
   462‚Üí                    temperature=options["temperature"],
   463‚Üí                    max_tokens=options["num_predict"],
   464‚Üí                    stream=False,
   465‚Üí                )
   466‚Üí
   467‚Üí                if response and str(response).strip():
   468‚Üí                    return OllamaResponse(
   469‚Üí                        content=str(response),
   470‚Üí                        model=self.model_name,
   471‚Üí                        created_at=str(time.time()),
   472‚Üí                        done=True,
   473‚Üí                    )
   474‚Üí
   475‚Üí            except Exception as e:
   476‚Üí                last_error = e
   477‚Üí                logger.warning(f"Generation attempt {attempt + 1} failed: {e}")
   478‚Üí
   479‚Üí                # Adjust options for retry
   480‚Üí                if attempt == 1:
   481‚Üí                    options["num_predict"] = max(256, options["num_predict"] // 2)
   482‚Üí                    options["temperature"] = 0.2
   483‚Üí                elif attempt == 2:
   484‚Üí                    options["num_predict"] = 128
   485‚Üí                    options["temperature"] = 0.3
   486‚Üí                    options["num_gpu"] = 0  # Force CPU
   487‚Üí
   488‚Üí                await asyncio.sleep(0.5)  # Brief delay before retry
   489‚Üí
   490‚Üí        # If all attempts failed, raise the last error
   491‚Üí        raise last_error or Exception("All generation attempts failed")
   492‚Üí
   493‚Üí    def _post_process_code(self, generated_code: str, language: str) -> str:
   494‚Üí        """
   495‚Üí        Post-process generated code to improve quality.
   496‚Üí
   497‚Üí        Args:
   498‚Üí            generated_code: Raw generated code
   499‚Üí            language: Programming language
   500‚Üí
   501‚Üí        Returns:
   502‚Üí            Processed code
   503‚Üí        """
   504‚Üí        if not generated_code:
   505‚Üí            return ""
   506‚Üí
   507‚Üí        # Remove markdown code blocks if present
   508‚Üí        code = re.sub(r"```\w*\n", "", generated_code)
   509‚Üí        code = re.sub(r"```\s*$", "", code)
   510‚Üí
   511‚Üí        # Remove leading/trailing whitespace
   512‚Üí        code = code.strip()
   513‚Üí
   514‚Üí        # Basic syntax validation for Python
   515‚Üí        if language.lower() == "python":
   516‚Üí            try:
   517‚Üí                compile(code, "<string>", "exec")
   518‚Üí            except SyntaxError as e:
   519‚Üí                logger.warning(f"Generated code has syntax error: {e}")
   520‚Üí                # Try to fix common issues
   521‚Üí                code = self._fix_common_syntax_issues(code)
   522‚Üí
   523‚Üí        return code
   524‚Üí
   525‚Üí    def _fix_common_syntax_issues(self, code: str) -> str:
   526‚Üí        """
   527‚Üí        Fix common syntax issues in generated code.
   528‚Üí
   529‚Üí        Args:
   530‚Üí            code: Code with potential syntax issues
   531‚Üí
   532‚Üí        Returns:
   533‚Üí            Fixed code
   534‚Üí        """
   535‚Üí        lines = code.split("\n")
   536‚Üí        fixed_lines = [self._fix_line_syntax(line.rstrip()) for line in lines]
   537‚Üí        return "\n".join(fixed_lines)
   538‚Üí
   539‚Üí    def _fix_line_syntax(self, line: str) -> str:
   540‚Üí        """Fix syntax issues in a single line."""
   541‚Üí        if not line.strip():
   542‚Üí            return line
   543‚Üí
   544‚Üí        # Keywords that need colons
   545‚Üí        colon_keywords = [
   546‚Üí            "def ",
   547‚Üí            "class ",
   548‚Üí            "if ",
   549‚Üí            "for ",
   550‚Üí            "while ",
   551‚Üí            "elif ",
   552‚Üí            "else",
   553‚Üí            "try",
   554‚Üí            "except",
   555‚Üí            "finally",
   556‚Üí        ]
   557‚Üí
   558‚Üí        for keyword in colon_keywords:
   559‚Üí            if self._line_needs_colon(line, keyword):
   560‚Üí                return line + ":"
   561‚Üí
   562‚Üí        return line
   563‚Üí
   564‚Üí    def _line_needs_colon(self, line: str, keyword: str) -> bool:
   565‚Üí        """Check if a line with a keyword needs a colon."""
   566‚Üí        stripped = line.strip()
   567‚Üí        return (
   568‚Üí            stripped.startswith(keyword)
   569‚Üí            and not stripped.endswith(":")
   570‚Üí            and not stripped.endswith("\\")
   571‚Üí        )
   572‚Üí
   573‚Üí    def _calculate_confidence(
   574‚Üí        self, response: OllamaResponse, request: GenerationRequest
   575‚Üí    ) -> float:
   576‚Üí        """
   577‚Üí        Calculate confidence score for generated code.
   578‚Üí
   579‚Üí        Args:
   580‚Üí            response: Generated response
   581‚Üí            request: Original request
   582‚Üí
   583‚Üí        Returns:
   584‚Üí            Confidence score (0.0 to 1.0)
   585‚Üí        """
   586‚Üí        if not response.content.strip():
   587‚Üí            return 0.0
   588‚Üí
   589‚Üí        # Base confidence
   590‚Üí        confidence = 0.5
   591‚Üí
   592‚Üí        # Length factor (longer code might be more complete)
   593‚Üí        code_length = len(response.content)
   594‚Üí        if code_length > 100:
   595‚Üí            confidence += 0.2
   596‚Üí        elif code_length > 50:
   597‚Üí            confidence += 0.1
   598‚Üí
   599‚Üí        # Check for common patterns that indicate good code
   600‚Üí        good_patterns = [
   601‚Üí            r"def\s+\w+\s*\(",  # Function definition
   602‚Üí            r"class\s+\w+",  # Class definition
   603‚Üí            r"import\s+",  # Import statement
   604‚Üí            r"return\s+",  # Return statement
   605‚Üí            r'"""',  # Docstring
   606‚Üí            r"#\s+",  # Comments
   607‚Üí        ]
   608‚Üí
   609‚Üí        for pattern in good_patterns:
   610‚Üí            if re.search(pattern, response.content):
   611‚Üí                confidence += 0.05
   612‚Üí
   613‚Üí        # Check for potential issues
   614‚Üí        bad_patterns = [
   615‚Üí            r"\.\.\.",  # Ellipsis (incomplete code)
   616‚Üí            r"TODO",  # TODO comments
   617‚Üí            r"FIXME",  # FIXME comments
   618‚Üí            r"pass\s*$",  # Empty pass statements
   619‚Üí        ]
   620‚Üí
   621‚Üí        for pattern in bad_patterns:
   622‚Üí            if re.search(pattern, response.content, re.IGNORECASE):
   623‚Üí                confidence -= 0.1
   624‚Üí
   625‚Üí        return max(0.0, min(1.0, confidence))
   626‚Üí
   627‚Üí    def _estimate_tokens(self, text: str) -> int:
   628‚Üí        """
   629‚Üí        Estimate token count for text.
   630‚Üí
   631‚Üí        Args:
   632‚Üí            text: Text to estimate tokens for
   633‚Üí
   634‚Üí        Returns:
   635‚Üí            Estimated token count
   636‚Üí        """
   637‚Üí        # Rough estimation: 1 token ‚âà 4 characters
   638‚Üí        return len(text) // 4
   639‚Üí
   640‚Üí    def _update_stats(self, success: bool, generation_time: float) -> None:
   641‚Üí        """
   642‚Üí        Update generation statistics.
   643‚Üí
   644‚Üí        Args:
   645‚Üí            success: Whether generation was successful
   646‚Üí            generation_time: Time taken for generation
   647‚Üí        """
   648‚Üí        self.generation_stats["total_generations"] += 1
   649‚Üí
   650‚Üí        if success:
   651‚Üí            self.generation_stats["successful_generations"] += 1
   652‚Üí        else:
   653‚Üí            self.generation_stats["failed_generations"] += 1
   654‚Üí
   655‚Üí        # Update average generation time
   656‚Üí        current_avg = self.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"]
   657‚Üí        total = self.generation_stats["total_generations"]
   658‚Üí        self.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] = (
   659‚Üí            current_avg * (total - 1) + generation_time
   660‚Üí        ) / total
   661‚Üí
   662‚Üí    async def _store_successful_pattern(
   663‚Üí        self, request: GenerationRequest, generated_code: str, confidence: float
   664‚Üí    ) -> None:
   665‚Üí        """
   666‚Üí        Store successful generation pattern in memory database.
   667‚Üí
   668‚Üí        Args:
   669‚Üí            request: Original generation request
   670‚Üí            generated_code: Generated code
   671‚Üí            confidence: Confidence score
   672‚Üí        """
   673‚Üí        try:
   674‚Üí            if self.memory_db:
   675‚Üí                self.memory_db.store_successful_pattern(
   676‚Üí                    before=request.prompt,
   677‚Üí                    after=generated_code,
   678‚Üí                    task=request.generation_type.value,
   679‚Üí                    language=request.language,
   680‚Üí                    quality_score=confidence,
   681‚Üí                    metadata={
   682‚Üí                        "generation_type": request.generation_type.value,
   683‚Üí                        "confidence": confidence,
   684‚Üí                        "constraints": request.constraints or [],
   685‚Üí                    },
   686‚Üí                )
   687‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   688‚Üí            logger.warning(f"Failed to store successful pattern: {e}")
   689‚Üí
   690‚Üí    async def _store_failed_pattern(
   691‚Üí        self, request: GenerationRequest, error_message: str
   692‚Üí    ) -> None:
   693‚Üí        """
   694‚Üí        Store failed generation pattern in memory database.
   695‚Üí
   696‚Üí        Args:
   697‚Üí            request: Original generation request
   698‚Üí            error_message: Error message
   699‚Üí        """
   700‚Üí        try:
   701‚Üí            if self.memory_db:
   702‚Üí                self.memory_db.store_failed_pattern(
   703‚Üí                    before=request.prompt,
   704‚Üí                    error_message=error_message,
   705‚Üí                    task=request.generation_type.value,
   706‚Üí                    language=request.language,
   707‚Üí                )
   708‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   709‚Üí            logger.warning(f"Failed to store failed pattern: {e}")
   710‚Üí
   711‚Üí    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   712‚Üí        """
   713‚Üí        Get generation statistics.
   714‚Üí
   715‚Üí        Returns:
   716‚Üí            Dictionary with generation statistics
   717‚Üí        """
   718‚Üí        return {
   719‚Üí            **self.generation_stats,
   720‚Üí            "memory_thresholds": self.memory_thresholds,
   721‚Üí            "model_name": self.model_name,
   722‚Üí            "current_memory_usage": self._get_memory_usage(),
   723‚Üí        }
   724‚Üí
   725‚Üí    async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   726‚Üí        """
   727‚Üí        Perform health check of the code generator.
   728‚Üí
   729‚Üí        Returns:
   730‚Üí            Health status dictionary
   731‚Üí        """
   732‚Üí        try:
   733‚Üí            # Check Ollama connection
   734‚Üí            ollama_healthy = self.ollama_client.health_check()
   735‚Üí
   736‚Üí            # Check memory status
   737‚Üí            memory_status = await self._check_memory_status()
   738‚Üí
   739‚Üí            # Check model availability
   740‚Üí            models = await self.ollama_client.list_models()
   741‚Üí            model_available = any(model["name"] == self.model_name for model in models)
   742‚Üí
   743‚Üí            return {
   744‚Üí                "status": (
   745‚Üí                    "healthy" if ollama_healthy and model_available else "unhealthy"
   746‚Üí                ),
   747‚Üí                "ollama_healthy": ollama_healthy,
   748‚Üí                "model_available": model_available,
   749‚Üí                "memory_status": memory_status.value,
   750‚Üí                "memory_usage": self._get_memory_usage(),
   751‚Üí                "generation_stats": self.generation_stats,
   752‚Üí            }
   753‚Üí
   754‚Üí        except Exception as e:
   755‚Üí            logger.error(f"Health check failed: {e}")
   756‚Üí            return {"status": "unhealthy", "error": str(e)}
   757‚Üí

   759‚Üíasync def test_firstspirit_module_generation() -> None:

   762‚Üí

"""
Code Generator optimized for RX 7900 XT with Ollama integration.

This module provides intelligent code generation capabilities with
memory management optimized for 20GB VRAM and ROCm 6.3 acceleration.
"""

import asyncio
import logging
import re
import time
from dataclasses import dataclass
from enum import Enum
from typing import Any, Dict, List, Optional

import psutil

try:
    import GPUtil

    GPUTIL_AVAILABLE = True
except ImportError:
    GPUTIL_AVAILABLE = False
    print("Warning: GPUtil not available. GPU monitoring will be limited.")

from backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaClient, OllamaResponse
from memory import Memory
from src.constants import TEST_FS_MEMORY_DB

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

# Add this constant at the top of the file (after imports)
GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS = (
    "Generate only the code without explanations. Ensure the code is:\n"
    "- Well-structured and readable\n"
    "- Follows best practices\n"
    "- Includes proper error handling\n"
    "- Has appropriate documentation\n\n"
    "Code:"
)


class GenerationType(Enum):
    """Types of code generation tasks."""

    FUNCTION = "function"
    CLASS = "class"
    MODULE = "module"
    REFACTOR = "refactor"
    TEST = "test"
    DOCUMENTATION = "documentation"
    BUGFIX = "bugfix"


class MemoryStatus(Enum):
    """Memory status for GPU operations."""

    OK = "ok"
    WARNING = "warning"
    CRITICAL = "critical"


@dataclass
class GenerationRequest:
    """Request for code generation."""

    prompt: str
    generation_type: GenerationType
    language: str = "python"
    context: Optional[str] = None
    constraints: Optional[List[str]] = None
    max_tokens: Optional[int] = None
    temperature: Optional[float] = None


@dataclass
class GenerationResponse:
    """Response from code generation."""

    success: bool
    generated_code: str
    confidence: float
    generation_time: float
    tokens_used: int
    memory_usage: Dict[str, Any]
    warnings: List[str]
    metadata: Dict[str, Any]


class CodeGenerator:
    """An intelligent code generator optimized for local hardware, especially GPUs.

    This class manages the entire code generation lifecycle, from prompt
    optimization and memory monitoring to generation with fallback strategies
    and post-processing. It is specifically tuned for use with Ollama and
    can be configured for different hardware profiles (e.g., RX 7900 XT).

    Attributes:
        ollama_client (OllamaClient): The client for interacting with the Ollama service.
        memory_db (Optional[Memory]): The memory system for learning from past generations.
        model_name (str): The primary model used for code generation.
        embedding_model (str): The model used for creating embeddings.
        default_options (Dict[str, Any]): Default parameters for the generation model.
        memory_thresholds (Dict[str, Any]): Thresholds for VRAM usage to trigger warnings or fallbacks.
        generation_stats (Dict[str, Any]): A dictionary for tracking performance metrics.
    """

    def __init__(
        self,
        ollama_client: OllamaClient,
        memory_db: Optional[Memory] = None,
        model_name: str = "llama2",
        embedding_model: str = "nomic-embed-text",
    ) -> None:
        """
        Initialize the Code Generator.

        Args:
            ollama_client: Ollama client instance
            memory_db: Memory database for pattern learning
            model_name: Model to use for generation
            embedding_model: Model to use for embeddings
        """
        self.ollama_client = ollama_client
        self.memory_db = memory_db
        self.model_name = model_name
        self.embedding_model = embedding_model

        # RX 7900 XT optimized settings for codellama:13b-instruct
        self.default_options = {
            "temperature": 0.1,
            "num_predict": 4096,  # Increased for 20GB VRAM
            "num_ctx": 8192,  # Larger context window
            "num_gpu": 35,  # More GPU layers for ROCm 6.3
            "num_thread": 8,  # More CPU threads as backup
        }

        # Memory thresholds for RX 7900 XT (20GB VRAM)
        self.memory_thresholds = {
            "warning": 16.0,  # GB
            "critical": 18.0,  # GB
            "max_ctx": 8192,  # Maximum context tokens
            "max_tokens": 4096,  # Maximum generation tokens
        }

        # Performance tracking
        self.generation_stats = {
            "total_generations": 0,
            "successful_generations": 0,
            "failed_generations": 0,
            "avg_generation_time": 0.0,
            "memory_warnings": 0,
        }

    async def generate_code(self, request: GenerationRequest) -> GenerationResponse:
        """
        Generate code based on the request.

        Args:
            request: Generation request with prompt and parameters

        Returns:
            GenerationResponse with results and metadata
        """
        start_time = time.time()
        warnings = []

        try:
            # Check memory status before generation
            memory_status = await self._check_memory_status()
            if memory_status == MemoryStatus.CRITICAL:
                return GenerationResponse(
                    success=False,
                    generated_code="",
                    confidence=0.0,
                    generation_time=time.time() - start_time,
                    tokens_used=0,
                    memory_usage=self._get_memory_usage(),
                    warnings=["Critical memory usage - generation aborted"],
                    metadata={"error": "insufficient_memory"},
                )

            if memory_status == MemoryStatus.WARNING:
                warnings.append("High memory usage detected")
                self.generation_stats["memory_warnings"] += 1

            # Build optimized prompt
            prompt = await self._build_optimized_prompt(request)

            # Adjust generation parameters based on memory status
            options = self._get_optimized_options(request, memory_status)

            # Generate code
            response = await self._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)

            # Post-process generated code
            processed_code = self._post_process_code(response.content, request.language)

            # Calculate confidence
            confidence = self._calculate_confidence(response, request)

            # Update statistics
            generation_time = time.time() - start_time
            self._update_stats(True, generation_time)

            # Store successful pattern if memory database is available
            if self.memory_db and response.content.strip():
                await self._store_successful_pattern(
                    request, processed_code, confidence
                )

            return GenerationResponse(
                success=True,
                generated_code=processed_code,
                confidence=confidence,
                generation_time=generation_time,
                tokens_used=self._estimate_tokens(response.content),
                memory_usage=self._get_memory_usage(),
                warnings=warnings,
                metadata={
                    "model_used": self.model_name,
                    "generation_type": request.generation_type.value,
                    "memory_status": memory_status.value,
                },
            )

        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Code generation failed: {e}")

            # Store failed pattern if memory database is available
            if self.memory_db:
                await self._store_failed_pattern(request, str(e))

            generation_time = time.time() - start_time
            self._update_stats(False, generation_time)

            return GenerationResponse(
                success=False,
                generated_code="",
                confidence=0.0,
                generation_time=generation_time,
                tokens_used=0,
                memory_usage=self._get_memory_usage(),
                warnings=[f"Generation failed: {str(e)}"],
                metadata={"error": str(e)},
            )

    async def _check_memory_status(self) -> MemoryStatus:
        """
        Check current memory usage and return status.

        Returns:
            MemoryStatus indicating current memory state
        """
        try:
            # Check GPU memory first if available
            if GPUTIL_AVAILABLE:
                gpu_status = self._check_gpu_memory_status()
                if gpu_status is not None:
                    return gpu_status

            # Fallback to system memory check
            return self._check_system_memory_status()

        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning(f"Memory check failed: {e}")
            return MemoryStatus.OK  # Assume OK if check fails

    def _check_gpu_memory_status(self) -> Optional[MemoryStatus]:
        """Check GPU memory status and return MemoryStatus if available."""
        try:
            gpus = GPUtil.getGPUs()
            if not gpus:
                return None

            gpu = gpus[0]  # Assume first GPU
            gpu_memory_used = gpu.memoryUsed
            gpu_memory_gb = gpu_memory_used / 1024

            return self._get_memory_status_from_gb(gpu_memory_gb)
        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning(f"GPU memory check failed: {e}")
            return None

    def _check_system_memory_status(self) -> MemoryStatus:
        """Check system memory status."""
        system_memory = psutil.virtual_memory()
        memory_gb = system_memory.used / (1024**3)
        return self._get_memory_status_from_gb(memory_gb)

    def _get_memory_status_from_gb(self, memory_gb: float) -> MemoryStatus:
        """Get memory status based on memory usage in GB."""
        if memory_gb >= self.memory_thresholds["critical"]:
            return MemoryStatus.CRITICAL
        elif memory_gb >= self.memory_thresholds["warning"]:
            return MemoryStatus.WARNING
        else:
            return MemoryStatus.OK

    def _get_memory_usage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Get current memory usage statistics.

        Returns:
            Dictionary with memory usage information
        """
        try:
            # System memory
            system_memory = psutil.virtual_memory()

            # GPU memory if available
            gpu_info = self._get_gpu_memory_info()

            return {
                "system_memory_used_gb": system_memory.used / (1024**3),
                "system_memory_total_gb": system_memory.total / (1024**3),
                "system_memory_percent": system_memory.percent,
                "gpu_memory": gpu_info,
            }

        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Memory usage check failed: {e}")
            return {"error": str(e)}

    def _get_gpu_memory_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get GPU memory information if available."""
        try:
            if not GPUTIL_AVAILABLE:
                return {}

            gpus = GPUtil.getGPUs()
            if not gpus:
                return {}

            gpu = gpus[0]
            return {
                "gpu_memory_used_gb": gpu.memoryUsed / 1024,
                "gpu_memory_total_gb": gpu.memoryTotal / 1024,
                "gpu_memory_percent": (gpu.memoryUsed / gpu.memoryTotal) * 100,
            }
        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning(f"GPU memory check failed: {e}")
            return {}

    async def _build_optimized_prompt(self, request: GenerationRequest) -> str:
        """
        Build an optimized prompt for code generation.

        Args:
            request: Generation request

        Returns:
            Optimized prompt string
        """
        # Base prompt template
        expert_intro = f"You are an expert {
            request.language} developer. Generate clean, professional code."
        task_info = (
            f"Task: {request.generation_type.value}\nLanguage: {request.language}"
        )
        requirements_section = f"Requirements:\n{request.prompt}"

        base_prompt = f"{expert_intro}\n\n{task_info}\n\n{requirements_section}\n\n"

        # Add context if provided
        if request.context:
            base_prompt += f"Context:\n{request.context}\n\n"

        # Add constraints if provided
        if request.constraints:
            base_prompt += "Constraints:\n"
            for constraint in request.constraints:
                base_prompt += f"- {constraint}\n"
            base_prompt += "\n"

        # Add similar patterns from memory if available
        if self.memory_db:
            try:
                similar_patterns = self.memory_db.get_similar_patterns(
                    request.generation_type.value,
                    language=request.language,
                    limit=3,
                )

                if similar_patterns:
                    base_prompt += "Similar patterns found:\n"
                    for pattern in similar_patterns[
                        :2
                    ]:  # Limit to 2 patterns to save context
                        base_prompt += f"Pattern: {pattern['after_code']}\n"
                    base_prompt += "\n"

            except Exception as e:
                logger.warning(f"Failed to retrieve similar patterns: {e}")

        # Add generation instructions
        base_prompt += GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS

        return base_prompt

    def _get_optimized_options(
        self, request: GenerationRequest, memory_status: MemoryStatus
    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Get optimized generation options based on memory status.

        Args:
            request: Generation request
            memory_status: Current memory status

        Returns:
            Optimized options dictionary
        """
        options = self.default_options.copy()

        # Override with request parameters if provided
        if request.temperature is not None:
            options["temperature"] = request.temperature

        if request.max_tokens is not None:
            options["num_predict"] = min(
                request.max_tokens, self.memory_thresholds["max_tokens"]
            )

        # Adjust based on memory status
        if memory_status == MemoryStatus.WARNING:
            options["num_predict"] = min(options["num_predict"], 512)
            options["num_ctx"] = min(options["num_ctx"], 1024)
            options["num_gpu"] = 0  # Fallback to CPU
            options["num_thread"] = 2

        elif memory_status == MemoryStatus.CRITICAL:
            options["num_predict"] = 256
            options["num_ctx"] = 512
            options["num_gpu"] = 0  # Force CPU
            options["num_thread"] = 1

        return options

    async def _generate_with_fallback(
        self, prompt: str, options: Dict[str, Any]
    ) -> OllamaResponse:
        """
        Generate code with fallback strategies.

        Args:
            prompt: Optimized prompt
            options: Generation options

        Returns:
            OllamaResponse with generated content
        """
        max_retries = 3
        last_error = None

        for attempt in range(max_retries):
            try:
                # Try with current options
                response = await self.ollama_client.generate_completion(
                    prompt=prompt,
                    model=self.model_name,
                    temperature=options["temperature"],
                    max_tokens=options["num_predict"],
                    stream=False,
                )

                if response and str(response).strip():
                    return OllamaResponse(
                        content=str(response),
                        model=self.model_name,
                        created_at=str(time.time()),
                        done=True,
                    )

            except Exception as e:
                last_error = e
                logger.warning(f"Generation attempt {attempt + 1} failed: {e}")

                # Adjust options for retry
                if attempt == 1:
                    options["num_predict"] = max(256, options["num_predict"] // 2)
                    options["temperature"] = 0.2
                elif attempt == 2:
                    options["num_predict"] = 128
                    options["temperature"] = 0.3
                    options["num_gpu"] = 0  # Force CPU

                await asyncio.sleep(0.5)  # Brief delay before retry

        # If all attempts failed, raise the last error
        raise last_error or Exception("All generation attempts failed")

    def _post_process_code(self, generated_code: str, language: str) -> str:
        """
        Post-process generated code to improve quality.

        Args:
            generated_code: Raw generated code
            language: Programming language

        Returns:
            Processed code
        """
        if not generated_code:
            return ""

        # Remove markdown code blocks if present
        code = re.sub(r"```\w*\n", "", generated_code)
        code = re.sub(r"```\s*$", "", code)

        # Remove leading/trailing whitespace
        code = code.strip()

        # Basic syntax validation for Python
        if language.lower() == "python":
            try:
                compile(code, "<string>", "exec")
            except SyntaxError as e:
                logger.warning(f"Generated code has syntax error: {e}")
                # Try to fix common issues
                code = self._fix_common_syntax_issues(code)

        return code

    def _fix_common_syntax_issues(self, code: str) -> str:
        """
        Fix common syntax issues in generated code.

        Args:
            code: Code with potential syntax issues

        Returns:
            Fixed code
        """
        lines = code.split("\n")
        fixed_lines = [self._fix_line_syntax(line.rstrip()) for line in lines]
        return "\n".join(fixed_lines)

    def _fix_line_syntax(self, line: str) -> str:
        """Fix syntax issues in a single line."""
        if not line.strip():
            return line

        # Keywords that need colons
        colon_keywords = [
            "def ",
            "class ",
            "if ",
            "for ",
            "while ",
            "elif ",
            "else",
            "try",
            "except",
            "finally",
        ]

        for keyword in colon_keywords:
            if self._line_needs_colon(line, keyword):
                return line + ":"

        return line

    def _line_needs_colon(self, line: str, keyword: str) -> bool:
        """Check if a line with a keyword needs a colon."""
        stripped = line.strip()
        return (
            stripped.startswith(keyword)
            and not stripped.endswith(":")
            and not stripped.endswith("\\")
        )

    def _calculate_confidence(
        self, response: OllamaResponse, request: GenerationRequest
    ) -> float:
        """
        Calculate confidence score for generated code.

        Args:
            response: Generated response
            request: Original request

        Returns:
            Confidence score (0.0 to 1.0)
        """
        if not response.content.strip():
            return 0.0

        # Base confidence
        confidence = 0.5

        # Length factor (longer code might be more complete)
        code_length = len(response.content)
        if code_length > 100:
            confidence += 0.2
        elif code_length > 50:
            confidence += 0.1

        # Check for common patterns that indicate good code
        good_patterns = [
            r"def\s+\w+\s*\(",  # Function definition
            r"class\s+\w+",  # Class definition
            r"import\s+",  # Import statement
            r"return\s+",  # Return statement
            r'"""',  # Docstring
            r"#\s+",  # Comments
        ]

        for pattern in good_patterns:
            if re.search(pattern, response.content):
                confidence += 0.05

        # Check for potential issues
        bad_patterns = [
            r"\.\.\.",  # Ellipsis (incomplete code)
            r"TODO",  # TODO comments
            r"FIXME",  # FIXME comments
            r"pass\s*$",  # Empty pass statements
        ]

        for pattern in bad_patterns:
            if re.search(pattern, response.content, re.IGNORECASE):
                confidence -= 0.1

        return max(0.0, min(1.0, confidence))

    def _estimate_tokens(self, text: str) -> int:
        """
        Estimate token count for text.

        Args:
            text: Text to estimate tokens for

        Returns:
            Estimated token count
        """
        # Rough estimation: 1 token ‚âà 4 characters
        return len(text) // 4

    def _update_stats(self, success: bool, generation_time: float) -> None:
        """
        Update generation statistics.

        Args:
            success: Whether generation was successful
            generation_time: Time taken for generation
        """
        self.generation_stats["total_generations"] += 1

        if success:
            self.generation_stats["successful_generations"] += 1
        else:
            self.generation_stats["failed_generations"] += 1

        # Update average generation time
        current_avg = self.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"]
        total = self.generation_stats["total_generations"]
        self.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] = (
            current_avg * (total - 1) + generation_time
        ) / total

    async def _store_successful_pattern(
        self, request: GenerationRequest, generated_code: str, confidence: float
    ) -> None:
        """
        Store successful generation pattern in memory database.

        Args:
            request: Original generation request
            generated_code: Generated code
            confidence: Confidence score
        """
        try:
            if self.memory_db:
                self.memory_db.store_successful_pattern(
                    before=request.prompt,
                    after=generated_code,
                    task=request.generation_type.value,
                    language=request.language,
                    quality_score=confidence,
                    metadata={
                        "generation_type": request.generation_type.value,
                        "confidence": confidence,
                        "constraints": request.constraints or [],
                    },
                )
        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning(f"Failed to store successful pattern: {e}")

    async def _store_failed_pattern(
        self, request: GenerationRequest, error_message: str
    ) -> None:
        """
        Store failed generation pattern in memory database.

        Args:
            request: Original generation request
            error_message: Error message
        """
        try:
            if self.memory_db:
                self.memory_db.store_failed_pattern(
                    before=request.prompt,
                    error_message=error_message,
                    task=request.generation_type.value,
                    language=request.language,
                )
        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning(f"Failed to store failed pattern: {e}")

    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Get generation statistics.

        Returns:
            Dictionary with generation statistics
        """
        return {
            **self.generation_stats,
            "memory_thresholds": self.memory_thresholds,
            "model_name": self.model_name,
            "current_memory_usage": self._get_memory_usage(),
        }

    async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Perform health check of the code generator.

        Returns:
            Health status dictionary
        """
        try:
            # Check Ollama connection
            ollama_healthy = self.ollama_client.health_check()

            # Check memory status
            memory_status = await self._check_memory_status()

            # Check model availability
            models = await self.ollama_client.list_models()
            model_available = any(model["name"] == self.model_name for model in models)

            return {
                "status": (
                    "healthy" if ollama_healthy and model_available else "unhealthy"
                ),
                "ollama_healthy": ollama_healthy,
                "model_available": model_available,
                "memory_status": memory_status.value,
                "memory_usage": self._get_memory_usage(),
                "generation_stats": self.generation_stats,
            }

        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Health check failed: {e}")
            return {"status": "unhealthy", "error": str(e)}


async def test_firstspirit_module_generation() -> None:
    """
    Test function to generate a complete FirstSpirit module and verify GPU usage.

    This function demonstrates the CodeGenerator's ability to create
    production-ready FirstSpirit components with RX 7900 XT optimization.
    """
    import logging

    from backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaClient
    from memory import Memory

        print(f"Ollama Healthy: {health['ollama_healthy']}")
        print(f"Model Available: {health['model_available']}")
        print(f"Memory Status: {health['memory_status']}")

        if health["status"] != "healthy":
            print(
                "‚ùå Health check failed. Please ensure Ollama is running "

            )
            return

        # Test 1: Generate FirstSpirit Input Component
        print("\nüìù Test 1: Generating FirstSpirit Input Component")

        input_component_prompt = (
            "Create a complete FirstSpirit input component for a text field with validation.\n"
            "The component should:\n"
            "- Extend AbstractInputComponent<String>\n"
            "- Include proper imports for FirstSpirit API\n"
            "- Have validation for required fields\n"
            "- Include error handling\n"
            "- Follow FirstSpirit naming conventions\n"
            "- Include comprehensive JavaDoc comments"
        )

        input_component_request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt=input_component_prompt,
            generation_type=GenerationType.CLASS,
            language="java",
            constraints=[
                "Must extend AbstractInputComponent<String>",
                "Include proper FirstSpirit imports",
                "Add validation logic",
                "Include error handling",
                "Follow Java naming conventions",
            ],
        )

        input_response = await generator.generate_code(input_component_request)

        if input_response.success:
            print("‚úÖ Input Component Generated Successfully!")
            print(f"Confidence: {input_response.confidence:.2f}")
            print(f"Generation Time: {input_response.generation_time:.2f}s")
            print(f"Tokens Used: {input_response.tokens_used}")
            print(f"Memory Usage: {input_response.memory_usage}")

            print("\nüìÑ Generated Input Component:")
            print("-" * 30)
            print(input_response.generated_code)
        else:
            print("‚ùå Input Component Generation Failed!")
            print(f"Error: {input_response.warnings}")

        # Test 2: Generate FirstSpirit Output Channel
        print("\nüìù Test 2: Generating FirstSpirit Output Channel")

        output_channel_prompt = (
            "Create a complete FirstSpirit output channel for rendering HTML content.\n"
            "The output channel should:\n"
            "- Extend AbstractOutputChannel\n"
            "- Generate HTML output\n"
            "- Include proper error handling\n"
            "- Handle null values gracefully\n"
            "- Include logging for debugging\n"
            "- Follow FirstSpirit output channel patterns"
        )

        output_channel_request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt=output_channel_prompt,
            generation_type=GenerationType.CLASS,
            language="java",
            constraints=[
                "Must extend AbstractOutputChannel",
                "Generate HTML output",
                "Include error handling",
                "Handle null values",
                "Add logging",
            ],
        )

        output_response = await generator.generate_code(output_channel_request)

        if output_response.success:
            print("‚úÖ Output Channel Generated Successfully!")
            print(f"Confidence: {output_response.confidence:.2f}")
            print(f"Generation Time: {output_response.generation_time:.2f}s")
            print(f"Tokens Used: {output_response.tokens_used}")

            print("\nüìÑ Generated Output Channel:")
            print("-" * 30)
            print(output_response.generated_code)
        else:
            print("‚ùå Output Channel Generation Failed!")
            print(f"Error: {output_response.warnings}")

        # Test 3: Generate FirstSpirit Workflow
        print("\nüìù Test 3: Generating FirstSpirit Workflow")
        print("-" * 50)

        workflow_prompt = (
            "Create a complete FirstSpirit workflow for content approval.\n"
            "The workflow should:\n"
            "- Extend AbstractWorkflow\n"
            "- Include approval steps\n"
            "- Handle workflow transitions\n"
            "- Include proper error handling\n"
            "- Add workflow logging\n"
            "- Follow FirstSpirit workflow patterns"
        )

        workflow_request = GenerationRequest(

            generation_type=GenerationType.CLASS,
            language="java",
            constraints=[
                "Must extend AbstractWorkflow",
                "Include approval steps",
                "Handle transitions",
                "Add error handling",
                "Include logging",
            ],
        )

        workflow_response = await generator.generate_code(workflow_request)

        if workflow_response.success:
            print("‚úÖ Workflow Generated Successfully!")
            print(f"Confidence: {workflow_response.confidence:.2f}")
            print(f"Generation Time: {workflow_response.generation_time:.2f}s")
            print(f"Tokens Used: {workflow_response.tokens_used}")

            print("\nüìÑ Generated Workflow:")
            print("-" * 30)
            print(workflow_response.generated_code)
        else:
            print("‚ùå Workflow Generation Failed!")
            print(f"Error: {workflow_response.warnings}")

        # Performance Statistics
        print("\nüìä Performance Statistics")
        print("-" * 30)
        stats = generator.get_statistics()
        print(f"Total Generations: {stats['total_generations']}")

        print(f"Failed: {stats['failed_generations']}")

        print(f"Memory Warnings: {stats['memory_warnings']}")

        # Memory Database Statistics
        print("\nüíæ Memory Database Statistics")
        print("-" * 30)
        memory_stats = memory_db.get_statistics()
        print(f"Total Patterns: {memory_stats['total_patterns']}")
        print(f"Failed Patterns: {memory_stats['total_failed_patterns']}")
        print(f"Language Distribution: {memory_stats['language_distribution']}")
        print(f"Task Type Distribution: {memory_stats['task_type_distribution']}")

        print("\nüéâ FirstSpirit Module Generation Test Completed!")
        print("=" * 60)

    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Test failed: {e}")
        print(f"‚ùå Test failed: {e}")

    finally:
        # Cleanup
        try:
            import os

            if os.path.exists(TEST_FS_MEMORY_DB):
                os.remove(TEST_FS_MEMORY_DB)
                print("üßπ Test database cleaned up")
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Warning: Could not clean up test database: {e}")


if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Run the test
    asyncio.run(test_firstspirit_module_generation())

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/generator.py.

Tests all code generation functionality, memory management, and GPU optimization features.
"""

import time
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest

from src.generator import (
    CodeGenerator,
    GenerationRequest,
    GenerationResponse,
    GenerationType,
    MemoryStatus,
    GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS,
    test_firstspirit_module_generation,
)

        assert MemoryStatus.OK.value == "ok"
        assert MemoryStatus.WARNING.value == "warning"
        assert MemoryStatus.CRITICAL.value == "critical"


class TestGenerationRequest:
    """Test GenerationRequest dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_request_creation(self):

        request = GenerationRequest(

        assert request.temperature == 0.7

        )

             patch.object(code_generator, '_check_gpu_memory_status') as mock_gpu:
            mock_gpu.return_value = MemoryStatus.OK

    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_check_memory_status_gpu_unavailable(self, code_generator):
        """Test memory status check with GPU unavailable."""
        with patch('src.generator.GPUTIL_AVAILABLE', False), \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_check_system_memory_status') as mock_system:

    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_check_memory_status_exception(self, code_generator):
        """Test memory status check with exception."""
        with patch('src.generator.GPUTIL_AVAILABLE', True), \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_check_gpu_memory_status') as mock_gpu:
            mock_gpu.side_effect = Exception("GPU error")

            assert status == MemoryStatus.OK  # Default when check fails
    
    def test_check_gpu_memory_status_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test GPU memory status check success."""
        mock_gpu = Mock()
        mock_gpu.memoryUsed = 8192  # MB
        
        with patch('src.generator.GPUTIL_AVAILABLE', True), \

    def test_check_gpu_memory_status_warning(self, code_generator):
        """Test GPU memory status check with warning."""

        mock_gpu.memoryUsed = 17408  # 17GB in MB

    def test_check_system_memory_status(self, code_generator):
        """Test system memory status check."""

            )

    def test_get_memory_usage_exception(self, code_generator):
        """Test memory usage retrieval with exception."""
        with patch('psutil.virtual_memory') as mock_memory:
            mock_memory.side_effect = Exception("Memory error")

            generation_time=1.5,
            tokens_used=50,
            memory_usage={"system_memory_used_gb": 4.0},
            warnings=["High memory usage"],
            metadata={"model": "llama2"}
        )
        
        assert response.success is True
        assert response.generated_code == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.confidence == 0.8
        assert response.generation_time == 1.5
        assert response.tokens_used == 50
        assert response.memory_usage["system_memory_used_gb"] == 4.0
        assert response.warnings == ["High memory usage"]
        assert response.metadata["model"] == "llama2"

    @pytest.mark.asyncio

        """Test generation with fallback after retry."""
        prompt = "Test prompt"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 1000}
        
        # First call fails, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [
            Exception("First attempt failed"),
            "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 2

    def test_post_process_code_python_syntax_invalid(self, code_generator):
        """Test post-processing invalid Python code."""
        code = "def test()\n    return 42"  # Missing colon
        
        with patch.object(code_generator, '_fix_common_syntax_issues') as mock_fix:
            mock_fix.return_value = "def test():\n    return 42"
            
            result = code_generator._post_process_code(code, "python")
            
            mock_fix.assert_called_once_with(code)
            assert result == "def test():\n    return 42"
    
    def test_fix_common_syntax_issues(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing common syntax issues."""
        code = "def test()\n    pass\nif True\n    print('hello')"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_common_syntax_issues(code)
        
        assert "def test():" in result
        assert "if True:" in result
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing syntax issues in a single line."""
        assert code_generator._fix_line_syntax("def test()") == "def test():"
        assert code_generator._fix_line_syntax("if True") == "if True:"
        assert code_generator._fix_line_syntax("else") == "else:"
        assert code_generator._fix_line_syntax("def test():") == "def test():"  # Already has colon
        assert code_generator._fix_line_syntax("") == ""  # Empty line
    
    def test_line_needs_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test checking if a line needs a colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test()", "def ")
        assert not code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test():", "def ")
        assert not code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test() \\", "def ")
        assert not code_generator._line_needs_colon("define something", "def ")

    @pytest.mark.asyncio

        assert health["error"] == "Health check error"
