    def test_get_optimized_options_ok_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with OK memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            temperature=0.5,
            max_tokens=2048
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.OK)
        
        assert options["temperature"] == 0.5
        assert options["num_predict"] == 1024  # Limited by memory threshold
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 2048
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 1
        assert options["num_thread"] == 4
    
    def test_get_optimized_options_warning_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with warning memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.WARNING)
        
        assert options["num_predict"] == 512  # Reduced
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 1024  # Reduced
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 0  # Fallback to CPU
        assert options["num_thread"] == 2  # Reduced
    
    def test_get_optimized_options_critical_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with critical memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.CRITICAL)
        
        assert options["num_predict"] == 256  # Minimal
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 512  # Minimal
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 0  # Force CPU
        assert options["num_thread"] == 1  # Minimal
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success on first try."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test(): pass"
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.model == "llama2"
        assert response.done is True
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_retry(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success after retry."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        # First call fails, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [
            Exception("First attempt failed"),
            "def test(): pass"
        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"
        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 2
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_all_fail(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - all attempts fail."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = Exception("Always fails")
        
        with pytest.raises(Exception, match="Always fails"):
            await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 3
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_empty_response(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - empty response."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        # First call returns empty, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [
            "",
            "def test(): pass"
        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"

    def test_post_process_code_syntax_error(self, code_generator):

        code = "def test()\n    return True"  # Missing colon

            mock_fix.return_value = "def test():\n    return True"
            
            result = code_generator._post_process_code(code, "python")

    def test_fix_common_syntax_issues(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing common syntax issues."""
        code = "def test()\n    return True\nif True\n    pass"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_common_syntax_issues(code)
        
        assert "def test():" in result
        assert "if True:" in result
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_needs_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that needs colon."""

        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "def test():"
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_has_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that already has colon."""

        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "def test():"
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_empty(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing empty line syntax."""

        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "   "
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_def(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if def line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test()", "def ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test():", "def ") is False
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test() \\", "def ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_class(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if class line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test", "class ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test:", "class ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_if(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if if line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True", "if ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True:", "if ") is False

    def test_calculate_confidence_good_code(self, code_generator):

        )

    def test_calculate_confidence_bad_patterns(self, code_generator):
        """Test calculating confidence for code with bad patterns."""
        response = OllamaResponse(
            content='def add(a, b):\n    # TODO: implement\n    pass',
            model="llama2",
            created_at="2023-01-01",
            done=True
        )
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        confidence = code_generator._calculate_confidence(response, request)
        
        assert confidence < 0.5  # Should be lower due to TODO and pass

    def test_update_stats_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for successful generation."""
        code_generator._update_stats(True, 2.5)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 2.5
    
    def test_update_stats_failure(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for failed generation."""
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 1.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 1.0
    
    def test_update_stats_multiple(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for multiple generations."""
        code_generator._update_stats(True, 2.0)
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 4.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 2
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 3.0  # (2+4)/2
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_store_successful_pattern(self, code_generator):
        """Test storing successful pattern."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python",
            constraints=["Simple implementation"]
        )
        generated_code = "def test(): return True"
        confidence = 0.9
        
        await code_generator._store_successful_pattern(request, generated_code, confidence)
        
        code_generator.memory_db.store_successful_pattern.assert_called_once_with(
            before="Create a function",
            after="def test(): return True",
            task="function",
            language="python",
            quality_score=0.9,
            metadata={
                "generation_type": "function",
                "confidence": 0.9,
                "constraints": ["Simple implementation"]
            }
        )

        request = GenerationRequest(

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/backend/services/code_generator.py.

Tests all code generation functionality, memory management, and GPU optimization features.
"""

import asyncio
import time
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest

from src.backend.services.code_generator import (
    CodeGenerator,
    GenerationRequest,
    GenerationResponse,
    GenerationType,
    MemoryStatus,
    GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS,
)
from src.backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaResponse


@pytest.fixture
def mock_ollama_client():
    """Mock OllamaClient for testing."""
    client = AsyncMock()
    client.health_check.return_value = True
    client.list_models.return_value = [{"name": "llama2"}, {"name": "codellama:13b-instruct"}]
    client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
    return client


@pytest.fixture
def mock_memory_db():
    """Mock Memory database for testing."""
    memory = Mock()
    memory.get_similar_patterns.return_value = [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "before_code": "test before",
            "after_code": "test after",
            "task": "function",
            "similarity": 0.9
        }
    ]
    memory.store_successful_pattern.return_value = 1
    memory.store_failed_pattern.return_value = 2
    memory.get_statistics.return_value = {
        "total_patterns": 10,
        "total_failed_patterns": 1,
        "language_distribution": {"python": 5, "java": 5},
        "task_type_distribution": {"function": 8, "class": 2}
    }
    return memory


@pytest.fixture
def code_generator(mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
    """CodeGenerator instance for testing."""
    return CodeGenerator(
        ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
        memory_db=mock_memory_db,
        model_name="llama2",
        embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
    )


class TestGenerationType:
    """Test GenerationType enum."""
    
    def test_generation_type_values(self):
        """Test GenerationType enum values."""
        assert GenerationType.FUNCTION.value == "function"
        assert GenerationType.CLASS.value == "class"
        assert GenerationType.MODULE.value == "module"
        assert GenerationType.REFACTOR.value == "refactor"
        assert GenerationType.TEST.value == "test"
        assert GenerationType.DOCUMENTATION.value == "documentation"
        assert GenerationType.BUGFIX.value == "bugfix"


class TestMemoryStatus:
    """Test MemoryStatus enum."""
    
    def test_memory_status_values(self):
        """Test MemoryStatus enum values."""
        assert MemoryStatus.OK.value == "ok"
        assert MemoryStatus.WARNING.value == "warning"
        assert MemoryStatus.CRITICAL.value == "critical"


class TestGenerationRequest:
    """Test GenerationRequest dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_request_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest creation."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python",
            context="For testing purposes",
            constraints=["No external dependencies"],
            max_tokens=512,
            temperature=0.3
        )
        
        assert request.prompt == "Create a function"
        assert request.generation_type == GenerationType.FUNCTION
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context == "For testing purposes"
        assert request.constraints == ["No external dependencies"]
        assert request.max_tokens == 512
        assert request.temperature == 0.3
    
    def test_generation_request_defaults(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest with default values."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context is None
        assert request.constraints is None
        assert request.max_tokens is None
        assert request.temperature is None


class TestGenerationResponse:
    """Test GenerationResponse dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_response_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationResponse creation."""
        response = GenerationResponse(
            success=True,
            generated_code="def test(): pass",
            confidence=0.8,
            generation_time=2.5,
            tokens_used=100,
            memory_usage={"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0},
            warnings=["High memory usage"],
            metadata={"model": "llama2"}
        )
        
        assert response.success is True
        assert response.generated_code == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.confidence == 0.8
        assert response.generation_time == 2.5
        assert response.tokens_used == 100
        assert response.memory_usage == {"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0}
        assert response.warnings == ["High memory usage"]
        assert response.metadata == {"model": "llama2"}


class TestCodeGenerator:
    """Test CodeGenerator class."""
    
    def test_code_generator_initialization(self, mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
        """Test CodeGenerator initialization."""
        generator = CodeGenerator(
            ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
            memory_db=mock_memory_db,
            model_name="codellama",
            embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
        )
        
        assert generator.ollama_client == mock_ollama_client
        assert generator.memory_db == mock_memory_db
        assert generator.model_name == "codellama"
        assert generator.embedding_model == "nomic-embed-text"
        
        # Check default options
        assert generator.default_options["temperature"] == 0.1
        assert generator.default_options["num_predict"] == 1024
        assert generator.default_options["num_ctx"] == 2048
        assert generator.default_options["num_gpu"] == 1
        assert generator.default_options["num_thread"] == 4
        
        # Check memory thresholds
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["warning"] == 4.5
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["critical"] == 5.5
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["max_ctx"] == 2048
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["max_tokens"] == 1024
        
        # Check stats initialization
        assert generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 0.0
        assert generator.generation_stats["memory_warnings"] == 0
    
    def test_code_generator_default_models(self, mock_ollama_client):
        """Test CodeGenerator with default model names."""
        generator = CodeGenerator(ollama_client=mock_ollama_client)
        
        assert generator.model_name == "llama2"
        assert generator.embedding_model == "nomic-embed-text"
        assert generator.memory_db is None
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_code_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test successful code generation."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function that adds two numbers",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python"
        )
        
        with patch.object(code_generator, '_check_memory_status') as mock_memory, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_build_optimized_prompt') as mock_prompt, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_get_optimized_options') as mock_options, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_generate_with_fallback') as mock_generate, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_post_process_code') as mock_process, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_calculate_confidence') as mock_confidence, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_store_successful_pattern') as mock_store:
            
            mock_memory.return_value = MemoryStatus.OK
            mock_prompt.return_value = "optimized prompt"
            mock_options.return_value = {"temperature": 0.1}
            mock_response = OllamaResponse(
                content="def add(a, b): return a + b",
                model="llama2",
                created_at="2023-01-01",
                done=True
            )
            mock_generate.return_value = mock_response
            mock_process.return_value = "def add(a, b): return a + b"
            mock_confidence.return_value = 0.9
            
            response = await code_generator.generate_code(request)
            
            assert response.success is True
            assert response.generated_code == "def add(a, b): return a + b"
            assert response.confidence == 0.9
            assert response.generation_time > 0
            assert response.tokens_used > 0
            assert response.metadata["model_used"] == "llama2"
            assert response.metadata["generation_type"] == "function"
            assert response.metadata["memory_status"] == "ok"
            
            # Verify store pattern was called
            mock_store.assert_called_once()
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_code_critical_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test code generation with critical memory status."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        with patch.object(code_generator, '_check_memory_status') as mock_memory:

            assert response.metadata["error"] == "insufficient_memory"
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio

        )

        prompt = await code_generator._build_optimized_prompt(request)
        
        # Should still work without patterns
        assert "Create a function" in prompt
        assert GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS in prompt
    
    def test_get_optimized_options_ok_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with OK memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            temperature=0.5,
            max_tokens=2048
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.OK)
        
        assert options["temperature"] == 0.5
        assert options["num_predict"] == 1024  # Limited by memory threshold
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 2048
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 1
        assert options["num_thread"] == 4
    
    def test_get_optimized_options_warning_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with warning memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.WARNING)
        
        assert options["num_predict"] == 512  # Reduced
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 1024  # Reduced
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 0  # Fallback to CPU
        assert options["num_thread"] == 2  # Reduced
    
    def test_get_optimized_options_critical_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with critical memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.CRITICAL)
        
        assert options["num_predict"] == 256  # Minimal
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 512  # Minimal
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 0  # Force CPU
        assert options["num_thread"] == 1  # Minimal
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success on first try."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test(): pass"

        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"

        assert response.done is True
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_retry(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success after retry."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        # First call fails, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [

        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"
        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 2

    def test_fix_line_syntax_needs_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that needs colon."""

    def test_fix_line_syntax_has_colon(self, code_generator):

    def test_fix_line_syntax_empty(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing empty line syntax."""

    def test_line_needs_colon_def(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if def line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test()", "def ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test():", "def ") is False
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test() \\", "def ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_class(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if class line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test", "class ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test:", "class ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_if(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if if line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True", "if ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True:", "if ") is False
    
    def test_calculate_confidence_empty(self, code_generator):

        )

        )

    def test_calculate_confidence_good_code(self, code_generator):

        )

        )

    def test_calculate_confidence_bad_patterns(self, code_generator):

        )

        )

    def test_estimate_tokens(self, code_generator):
        """Test token estimation."""
        text = "def test(): return True"  # 23 characters
        
        tokens = code_generator._estimate_tokens(text)
        
        assert tokens == 5  # 23 / 4
    
    def test_update_stats_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for successful generation."""
        code_generator._update_stats(True, 2.5)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 2.5
    
    def test_update_stats_failure(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for failed generation."""
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 1.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 1.0
    
    def test_update_stats_multiple(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for multiple generations."""
        code_generator._update_stats(True, 2.0)
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 4.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 2
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 3.0  # (2+4)/2

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/backend/services/code_generator.py.

Tests all code generation functionality, memory management, and GPU optimization features.
"""

import asyncio
import time
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest

from src.backend.services.code_generator import (
    CodeGenerator,
    GenerationRequest,
    GenerationResponse,
    GenerationType,
    MemoryStatus,
    GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS,
)
from src.backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaResponse


@pytest.fixture
def mock_ollama_client():
    """Mock OllamaClient for testing."""
    client = AsyncMock()
    client.health_check.return_value = True
    client.list_models.return_value = [{"name": "llama2"}, {"name": "codellama:13b-instruct"}]
    client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
    return client


@pytest.fixture
def mock_memory_db():
    """Mock Memory database for testing."""
    memory = Mock()
    memory.get_similar_patterns.return_value = [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "before_code": "test before",
            "after_code": "test after",
            "task": "function",
            "similarity": 0.9
        }
    ]
    memory.store_successful_pattern.return_value = 1
    memory.store_failed_pattern.return_value = 2
    memory.get_statistics.return_value = {
        "total_patterns": 10,
        "total_failed_patterns": 1,
        "language_distribution": {"python": 5, "java": 5},
        "task_type_distribution": {"function": 8, "class": 2}
    }
    return memory


@pytest.fixture
def code_generator(mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
    """CodeGenerator instance for testing."""
    return CodeGenerator(
        ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
        memory_db=mock_memory_db,
        model_name="llama2",
        embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
    )


class TestGenerationType:
    """Test GenerationType enum."""
    
    def test_generation_type_values(self):
        """Test GenerationType enum values."""
        assert GenerationType.FUNCTION.value == "function"
        assert GenerationType.CLASS.value == "class"
        assert GenerationType.MODULE.value == "module"
        assert GenerationType.REFACTOR.value == "refactor"
        assert GenerationType.TEST.value == "test"
        assert GenerationType.DOCUMENTATION.value == "documentation"
        assert GenerationType.BUGFIX.value == "bugfix"


class TestMemoryStatus:
    """Test MemoryStatus enum."""
    
    def test_memory_status_values(self):
        """Test MemoryStatus enum values."""
        assert MemoryStatus.OK.value == "ok"
        assert MemoryStatus.WARNING.value == "warning"
        assert MemoryStatus.CRITICAL.value == "critical"


class TestGenerationRequest:
    """Test GenerationRequest dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_request_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest creation."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python",
            context="For testing purposes",
            constraints=["No external dependencies"],
            max_tokens=512,
            temperature=0.3
        )
        
        assert request.prompt == "Create a function"
        assert request.generation_type == GenerationType.FUNCTION
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context == "For testing purposes"
        assert request.constraints == ["No external dependencies"]
        assert request.max_tokens == 512
        assert request.temperature == 0.3
    
    def test_generation_request_defaults(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest with default values."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context is None
        assert request.constraints is None
        assert request.max_tokens is None
        assert request.temperature is None


class TestGenerationResponse:
    """Test GenerationResponse dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_response_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationResponse creation."""
        response = GenerationResponse(
            success=True,
            generated_code="def test(): pass",
            confidence=0.8,
            generation_time=2.5,
            tokens_used=100,
            memory_usage={"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0},
            warnings=["High memory usage"],
            metadata={"model": "llama2"}
        )
        
        assert response.success is True
        assert response.generated_code == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.confidence == 0.8
        assert response.generation_time == 2.5
        assert response.tokens_used == 100
        assert response.memory_usage == {"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0}
        assert response.warnings == ["High memory usage"]
        assert response.metadata == {"model": "llama2"}


class TestCodeGenerator:
    """Test CodeGenerator class."""
    
    def test_code_generator_initialization(self, mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
        """Test CodeGenerator initialization."""
        generator = CodeGenerator(
            ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
            memory_db=mock_memory_db,

    def test_get_memory_usage_with_gpu(self, code_generator):
        """Test memory usage retrieval with GPU."""

        mock_gpu.memoryTotal = 6000  # MB
        
        with patch('src.backend.services.code_generator.GPUtil') as mock_gputil, \
             patch('psutil.virtual_memory') as mock_memory:
            
            mock_gputil.getGPUs.return_value = [mock_gpu]
            mock_memory.return_value.used = 8 * 1024**3  # 8 GB
            mock_memory.return_value.total = 16 * 1024**3  # 16 GB

            usage = code_generator._get_memory_usage()

            assert usage["gpu_memory"]["gpu_memory_used_gb"] == 4000 / 1024
            assert usage["gpu_memory"]["gpu_memory_total_gb"] == 6000 / 1024

"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/backend/services/code_generator.py.

Tests all code generation functionality, memory management, and GPU optimization features.
"""

from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest

)

    client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
    return client


@pytest.fixture
def mock_memory_db():

    memory = Mock()
    memory.get_similar_patterns.return_value = [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "before_code": "test before",
            "after_code": "test after",
            "task": "function",
            "similarity": 0.9
        }
    ]
    memory.store_successful_pattern.return_value = 1

        "total_patterns": 10,
        "total_failed_patterns": 1,
        "language_distribution": {"python": 5, "java": 5},
        "task_type_distribution": {"function": 8, "class": 2}
    }
    return memory


@pytest.fixture

        model_name="llama2",
        embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
    )


class TestGenerationType:
    """Test GenerationType enum."""
    
    def test_generation_type_values(self):

        assert GenerationType.FUNCTION.value == "function"
        assert GenerationType.CLASS.value == "class"
        assert GenerationType.MODULE.value == "module"
        assert GenerationType.REFACTOR.value == "refactor"
        assert GenerationType.TEST.value == "test"
        assert GenerationType.DOCUMENTATION.value == "documentation"
        assert GenerationType.BUGFIX.value == "bugfix"

        assert MemoryStatus.OK.value == "ok"
        assert MemoryStatus.WARNING.value == "warning"
        assert MemoryStatus.CRITICAL.value == "critical"


class TestGenerationRequest:
    """Test GenerationRequest dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_request_creation(self):

        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",

            context="For testing purposes",

        )

        assert request.language == "python"

        )

            success=True,

        )

    async def test_generate_with_fallback_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success on first try."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test(): pass"
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.model == "llama2"
        assert response.done is True
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_retry(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success after retry."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        # First call fails, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [
            Exception("First attempt failed"),
            "def test(): pass"
        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"
        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 2
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_all_fail(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - all attempts fail."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = Exception("Always fails")
        
        with pytest.raises(Exception, match="Always fails"):
            await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 3
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_empty_response(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - empty response."""
        prompt = "Create a function"
        options = {"temperature": 0.1, "num_predict": 512}
        
        # First call returns empty, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [
            "",
            "def test(): pass"
        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)
        
        assert response.content == "def test(): pass"
    
    def test_post_process_code_empty(self, code_generator):
        """Test post-processing empty code."""
        result = code_generator._post_process_code("", "python")
        
        assert result == ""
    
    def test_post_process_code_remove_markdown(self, code_generator):
        """Test post-processing code with markdown blocks."""
        code = "```python\ndef test():\n    pass\n```"
        
        result = code_generator._post_process_code(code, "python")
        
        assert result == "def test():\n    pass"
    
    def test_post_process_code_syntax_valid(self, code_generator):
        """Test post-processing valid Python code."""
        code = "def test():\n    return True"
        
        result = code_generator._post_process_code(code, "python")
        
        assert result == "def test():\n    return True"
    
    def test_post_process_code_syntax_error(self, code_generator):
        """Test post-processing code with syntax error."""
        code = "def test()\n    return True"  # Missing colon
        
        with patch.object(code_generator, '_fix_common_syntax_issues') as mock_fix:
            mock_fix.return_value = "def test():\n    return True"
            
            result = code_generator._post_process_code(code, "python")
            
            mock_fix.assert_called_once_with(code)
    
    def test_post_process_code_non_python(self, code_generator):
        """Test post-processing non-Python code."""
        code = "public class Test { }"
        
        result = code_generator._post_process_code(code, "java")
        
        assert result == "public class Test { }"
    
    def test_fix_common_syntax_issues(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing common syntax issues."""
        code = "def test()\n    return True\nif True\n    pass"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_common_syntax_issues(code)
        
        assert "def test():" in result
        assert "if True:" in result
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_needs_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that needs colon."""
        line = "def test()"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "def test():"
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_has_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that already has colon."""
        line = "def test():"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "def test():"
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_empty(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing empty line syntax."""
        line = "   "
        
        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "   "
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_def(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if def line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test()", "def ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test():", "def ") is False
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test() \\", "def ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_class(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if class line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test", "class ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test:", "class ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_if(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if if line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True", "if ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True:", "if ") is False
    
    def test_calculate_confidence_empty(self, code_generator):
        """Test calculating confidence for empty code."""
        response = OllamaResponse(
            content="",
            model="llama2",
            created_at="2023-01-01",
            done=True
        )
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        confidence = code_generator._calculate_confidence(response, request)
        
        assert confidence == 0.0
    
    def test_calculate_confidence_good_code(self, code_generator):
        """Test calculating confidence for good code."""
        response = OllamaResponse(
            content='def add(a, b):\n    """Add two numbers"""\n    return a + b',
            model="llama2",
            created_at="2023-01-01",
            done=True
        )
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        confidence = code_generator._calculate_confidence(response, request)
        
        assert confidence > 0.7  # Should be high due to good patterns
    
    def test_calculate_confidence_bad_patterns(self, code_generator):
        """Test calculating confidence for code with bad patterns."""
        response = OllamaResponse(
            content='def add(a, b):\n    # TODO: implement\n    pass',
            model="llama2",
            created_at="2023-01-01",
            done=True
        )
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        confidence = code_generator._calculate_confidence(response, request)
        
        assert confidence < 0.5  # Should be lower due to TODO and pass

        """Test token estimation."""
        text = "def test(): return True"  # 23 characters
        
        tokens = code_generator._estimate_tokens(text)
        
        assert tokens == 5  # 23 / 4

        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 2.5
    
    def test_update_stats_failure(self, code_generator):

        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 1.0
    
    def test_update_stats_multiple(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for multiple generations."""
        code_generator._update_stats(True, 2.0)
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 4.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 2
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 3.0  # (2+4)/2
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_store_successful_pattern(self, code_generator):

        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",

            language="python",

        )

        code_generator.memory_db.store_successful_pattern.assert_called_once_with(

            task="function",

            }
        )

    async def test_health_check_healthy(self, code_generator):
        """Test health check when all is healthy."""
        with patch.object(code_generator.ollama_client, 'health_check', return_value=True), \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_check_memory_status') as mock_memory:
            
            mock_memory.return_value = MemoryStatus.OK
            
            health = await code_generator.health_check()
            
            assert health["status"] == "healthy"
            assert health["ollama_healthy"] is True
            assert health["model_available"] is True
            assert health["memory_status"] == "ok"
            assert "memory_usage" in health
            assert "generation_stats" in health
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_health_check_unhealthy_ollama(self, code_generator):
        """Test health check when Ollama is unhealthy."""
        with patch.object(code_generator.ollama_client, 'health_check', return_value=False), \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_check_memory_status') as mock_memory:
            
            mock_memory.return_value = MemoryStatus.OK
            
            health = await code_generator.health_check()
            
            assert health["status"] == "unhealthy"
            assert health["ollama_healthy"] is False

        with patch.object(code_generator.ollama_client, 'health_check', return_value=True), \

            mock_memory.return_value = MemoryStatus.OK
            
            health = await code_generator.health_check()
            
            assert health["status"] == "unhealthy"
            assert health["model_available"] is False

async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """
        Perform health check of the code generator.

        Returns:
            Health status dictionary
        """
        try:
            # Check Ollama connection
            ollama_healthy = self.ollama_client.health_check()

            # Check memory status
            memory_status = await self._check_memory_status()

            # Check model availability
            models = await self.ollama_client.list_models()
            model_available = any(model["name"] == self.model_name for model in models)

            return {
                "status": (
                    "healthy" if ollama_healthy and model_available else "unhealthy"
                ),
                "ollama_healthy": ollama_healthy,
                "model_available": model_available,
                "memory_status": memory_status.value,
                "memory_usage": self._get_memory_usage(),
                "generation_stats": self.generation_stats,
            }

        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Health check failed: {e}")
            return {"status": "unhealthy", "error": str(e)}

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/backend/services/code_generator.py.

Tests all code generation functionality, memory management, and GPU optimization features.
"""

import asyncio
import time
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest

from src.backend.services.code_generator import (
    CodeGenerator,
    GenerationRequest,
    GenerationResponse,
    GenerationType,
    MemoryStatus,
    GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS,
)
from src.backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaResponse


@pytest.fixture
def mock_ollama_client():
    """Mock OllamaClient for testing."""
    client = AsyncMock()
    client.health_check.return_value = True
    client.list_models.return_value = [{"name": "llama2"}, {"name": "codellama:13b-instruct"}]
    client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
    return client


@pytest.fixture
def mock_memory_db():
    """Mock Memory database for testing."""
    memory = Mock()
    memory.get_similar_patterns.return_value = [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "before_code": "test before",
            "after_code": "test after",
            "task": "function",
            "similarity": 0.9
        }
    ]
    memory.store_successful_pattern.return_value = 1
    memory.store_failed_pattern.return_value = 2
    memory.get_statistics.return_value = {
        "total_patterns": 10,
        "total_failed_patterns": 1,
        "language_distribution": {"python": 5, "java": 5},
        "task_type_distribution": {"function": 8, "class": 2}
    }
    return memory


@pytest.fixture
def code_generator(mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
    """CodeGenerator instance for testing."""
    return CodeGenerator(
        ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
        memory_db=mock_memory_db,
        model_name="llama2",
        embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
    )


class TestGenerationType:
    """Test GenerationType enum."""
    
    def test_generation_type_values(self):
        """Test GenerationType enum values."""
        assert GenerationType.FUNCTION.value == "function"
        assert GenerationType.CLASS.value == "class"
        assert GenerationType.MODULE.value == "module"
        assert GenerationType.REFACTOR.value == "refactor"
        assert GenerationType.TEST.value == "test"
        assert GenerationType.DOCUMENTATION.value == "documentation"
        assert GenerationType.BUGFIX.value == "bugfix"


class TestMemoryStatus:
    """Test MemoryStatus enum."""
    
    def test_memory_status_values(self):
        """Test MemoryStatus enum values."""
        assert MemoryStatus.OK.value == "ok"
        assert MemoryStatus.WARNING.value == "warning"
        assert MemoryStatus.CRITICAL.value == "critical"


class TestGenerationRequest:
    """Test GenerationRequest dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_request_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest creation."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python",
            context="For testing purposes",
            constraints=["No external dependencies"],
            max_tokens=512,
            temperature=0.3
        )
        
        assert request.prompt == "Create a function"
        assert request.generation_type == GenerationType.FUNCTION
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context == "For testing purposes"
        assert request.constraints == ["No external dependencies"]
        assert request.max_tokens == 512
        assert request.temperature == 0.3
    
    def test_generation_request_defaults(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest with default values."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context is None
        assert request.constraints is None
        assert request.max_tokens is None
        assert request.temperature is None


class TestGenerationResponse:
    """Test GenerationResponse dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_response_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationResponse creation."""
        response = GenerationResponse(
            success=True,
            generated_code="def test(): pass",
            confidence=0.8,
            generation_time=2.5,
            tokens_used=100,
            memory_usage={"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0},
            warnings=["High memory usage"],
            metadata={"model": "llama2"}
        )
        
        assert response.success is True
        assert response.generated_code == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.confidence == 0.8
        assert response.generation_time == 2.5
        assert response.tokens_used == 100
        assert response.memory_usage == {"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0}
        assert response.warnings == ["High memory usage"]
        assert response.metadata == {"model": "llama2"}


class TestCodeGenerator:
    """Test CodeGenerator class."""
    
    def test_code_generator_initialization(self, mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
        """Test CodeGenerator initialization."""
        generator = CodeGenerator(
            ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
            memory_db=mock_memory_db,
            model_name="codellama",
            embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
        )
        
        assert generator.ollama_client == mock_ollama_client
        assert generator.memory_db == mock_memory_db
        assert generator.model_name == "codellama"
        assert generator.embedding_model == "nomic-embed-text"
        
        # Check default options
        assert generator.default_options["temperature"] == 0.1
        assert generator.default_options["num_predict"] == 1024
        assert generator.default_options["num_ctx"] == 2048
        assert generator.default_options["num_gpu"] == 1
        assert generator.default_options["num_thread"] == 4
        
        # Check memory thresholds
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["warning"] == 4.5
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["critical"] == 5.5
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["max_ctx"] == 2048
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["max_tokens"] == 1024
        
        # Check stats initialization
        assert generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 0.0
        assert generator.generation_stats["memory_warnings"] == 0
    
    def test_code_generator_default_models(self, mock_ollama_client):
        """Test CodeGenerator with default model names."""
        generator = CodeGenerator(ollama_client=mock_ollama_client)
        
        assert generator.model_name == "llama2"
        assert generator.embedding_model == "nomic-embed-text"
        assert generator.memory_db is None
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_code_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test successful code generation."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function that adds two numbers",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python"
        )
        
        with patch.object(code_generator, '_check_memory_status') as mock_memory, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_build_optimized_prompt') as mock_prompt, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_get_optimized_options') as mock_options, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_generate_with_fallback') as mock_generate, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_post_process_code') as mock_process, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_calculate_confidence') as mock_confidence, \
             patch.object(code_generator, '_store_successful_pattern') as mock_store:
            
            mock_memory.return_value = MemoryStatus.OK
            mock_prompt.return_value = "optimized prompt"
            mock_options.return_value = {"temperature": 0.1}
            mock_response = OllamaResponse(
                content="def add(a, b): return a + b",
                model="llama2",
                created_at="2023-01-01",

            )
            mock_generate.return_value = mock_response
            mock_process.return_value = "def add(a, b): return a + b"
            mock_confidence.return_value = 0.9
            
            response = await code_generator.generate_code(request)
            
            assert response.success is True
            assert response.generated_code == "def add(a, b): return a + b"
            assert response.confidence == 0.9
            assert response.generation_time > 0
            assert response.tokens_used > 0
            assert response.metadata["model_used"] == "llama2"
            assert response.metadata["generation_type"] == "function"
            assert response.metadata["memory_status"] == "ok"
            
            # Verify store pattern was called
            mock_store.assert_called_once()

        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.WARNING)
        
        assert options["num_predict"] == 512  # Reduced
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 1024  # Reduced
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 0  # Fallback to CPU
        assert options["num_thread"] == 2  # Reduced
    
    def test_get_optimized_options_critical_memory(self, code_generator):
        """Test getting optimized options with critical memory."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        options = code_generator._get_optimized_options(request, MemoryStatus.CRITICAL)
        
        assert options["num_predict"] == 256  # Minimal
        assert options["num_ctx"] == 512  # Minimal
        assert options["num_gpu"] == 0  # Force CPU
        assert options["num_thread"] == 1  # Minimal
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio
    async def test_generate_with_fallback_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test generation with fallback - success on first try."""

        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test(): pass"

    async def test_generate_with_fallback_retry(self, code_generator):

        # First call fails, second succeeds
        code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.side_effect = [

        ]
        
        response = await code_generator._generate_with_fallback(prompt, options)

        assert code_generator.ollama_client.generate_completion.call_count == 2

    def test_post_process_code_non_python(self, code_generator):

    def test_fix_common_syntax_issues(self, code_generator):

        result = code_generator._fix_common_syntax_issues(code)
        
        assert "def test():" in result
        assert "if True:" in result
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_needs_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that needs colon."""
        line = "def test()"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "def test():"
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_has_colon(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing line syntax that already has colon."""
        line = "def test():"
        
        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "def test():"
    
    def test_fix_line_syntax_empty(self, code_generator):
        """Test fixing empty line syntax."""
        line = "   "
        
        result = code_generator._fix_line_syntax(line)
        
        assert result == "   "
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_def(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if def line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test()", "def ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test():", "def ") is False
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("def test() \\", "def ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_class(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if class line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test", "class ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("class Test:", "class ") is False
    
    def test_line_needs_colon_if(self, code_generator):
        """Test detecting if if line needs colon."""
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True", "if ") is True
        assert code_generator._line_needs_colon("if True:", "if ") is False
    
    def test_calculate_confidence_empty(self, code_generator):

            done=True
        )

        )

    def test_calculate_confidence_good_code(self, code_generator):

            model="llama2",

        )

            prompt="Create a function",

        )

    def test_calculate_confidence_bad_patterns(self, code_generator):
        """Test calculating confidence for code with bad patterns."""
        response = OllamaResponse(
            content='def add(a, b):\n    # TODO: implement\n    pass',

        )

            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )

    def test_estimate_tokens(self, code_generator):
        """Test token estimation."""
        text = "def test(): return True"  # 23 characters
        
        tokens = code_generator._estimate_tokens(text)
        
        assert tokens == 5  # 23 / 4
    
    def test_update_stats_success(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for successful generation."""

        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 2.5
    
    def test_update_stats_failure(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for failed generation."""
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 1.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 1.0
    
    def test_update_stats_multiple(self, code_generator):
        """Test updating stats for multiple generations."""
        code_generator._update_stats(True, 2.0)
        code_generator._update_stats(False, 4.0)
        
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 2
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 1
        assert code_generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 3.0  # (2+4)/2
    
    @pytest.mark.asyncio

            language="python",
            constraints=["Simple implementation"]
        )

            after="def test(): return True",
            task="function",
            language="python",
            quality_score=0.9,
            metadata={
                "generation_type": "function",
                "confidence": 0.9,
                "constraints": ["Simple implementation"]
            }
        )

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Comprehensive test suite for src/backend/services/code_generator.py.

Tests all code generation functionality, memory management, and GPU optimization features.
"""

import asyncio
import time
from unittest.mock import AsyncMock, Mock, patch

import pytest

from src.backend.services.code_generator import (
    CodeGenerator,
    GenerationRequest,
    GenerationResponse,
    GenerationType,
    MemoryStatus,
    GENERATION_INSTRUCTIONS,
)
from src.backend.services.ollama_client import OllamaResponse


@pytest.fixture
def mock_ollama_client():
    """Mock OllamaClient for testing."""
    client = AsyncMock()
    client.health_check.return_value = True
    client.list_models.return_value = [{"name": "llama2"}, {"name": "codellama:13b-instruct"}]
    client.generate_completion.return_value = "def test_function():\n    return 'generated code'"
    return client


@pytest.fixture
def mock_memory_db():
    """Mock Memory database for testing."""
    memory = Mock()
    memory.get_similar_patterns.return_value = [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "before_code": "test before",
            "after_code": "test after",
            "task": "function",
            "similarity": 0.9
        }
    ]
    memory.store_successful_pattern.return_value = 1
    memory.store_failed_pattern.return_value = 2
    memory.get_statistics.return_value = {
        "total_patterns": 10,
        "total_failed_patterns": 1,
        "language_distribution": {"python": 5, "java": 5},
        "task_type_distribution": {"function": 8, "class": 2}
    }
    return memory


@pytest.fixture
def code_generator(mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
    """CodeGenerator instance for testing."""
    return CodeGenerator(
        ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
        memory_db=mock_memory_db,
        model_name="llama2",
        embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
    )


class TestGenerationType:
    """Test GenerationType enum."""
    
    def test_generation_type_values(self):
        """Test GenerationType enum values."""
        assert GenerationType.FUNCTION.value == "function"
        assert GenerationType.CLASS.value == "class"
        assert GenerationType.MODULE.value == "module"
        assert GenerationType.REFACTOR.value == "refactor"
        assert GenerationType.TEST.value == "test"
        assert GenerationType.DOCUMENTATION.value == "documentation"
        assert GenerationType.BUGFIX.value == "bugfix"


class TestMemoryStatus:
    """Test MemoryStatus enum."""
    
    def test_memory_status_values(self):
        """Test MemoryStatus enum values."""
        assert MemoryStatus.OK.value == "ok"
        assert MemoryStatus.WARNING.value == "warning"
        assert MemoryStatus.CRITICAL.value == "critical"


class TestGenerationRequest:
    """Test GenerationRequest dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_request_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest creation."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION,
            language="python",
            context="For testing purposes",
            constraints=["No external dependencies"],
            max_tokens=512,
            temperature=0.3
        )
        
        assert request.prompt == "Create a function"
        assert request.generation_type == GenerationType.FUNCTION
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context == "For testing purposes"
        assert request.constraints == ["No external dependencies"]
        assert request.max_tokens == 512
        assert request.temperature == 0.3
    
    def test_generation_request_defaults(self):
        """Test GenerationRequest with default values."""
        request = GenerationRequest(
            prompt="Create a function",
            generation_type=GenerationType.FUNCTION
        )
        
        assert request.language == "python"
        assert request.context is None
        assert request.constraints is None
        assert request.max_tokens is None
        assert request.temperature is None


class TestGenerationResponse:
    """Test GenerationResponse dataclass."""
    
    def test_generation_response_creation(self):
        """Test GenerationResponse creation."""
        response = GenerationResponse(
            success=True,
            generated_code="def test(): pass",
            confidence=0.8,
            generation_time=2.5,
            tokens_used=100,
            memory_usage={"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0},
            warnings=["High memory usage"],
            metadata={"model": "llama2"}
        )
        
        assert response.success is True
        assert response.generated_code == "def test(): pass"
        assert response.confidence == 0.8
        assert response.generation_time == 2.5
        assert response.tokens_used == 100
        assert response.memory_usage == {"system_memory_used_gb": 2.0}
        assert response.warnings == ["High memory usage"]
        assert response.metadata == {"model": "llama2"}


class TestCodeGenerator:
    """Test CodeGenerator class."""
    
    def test_code_generator_initialization(self, mock_ollama_client, mock_memory_db):
        """Test CodeGenerator initialization."""
        generator = CodeGenerator(
            ollama_client=mock_ollama_client,
            memory_db=mock_memory_db,
            model_name="codellama",
            embedding_model="nomic-embed-text"
        )
        
        assert generator.ollama_client == mock_ollama_client
        assert generator.memory_db == mock_memory_db
        assert generator.model_name == "codellama"
        assert generator.embedding_model == "nomic-embed-text"
        
        # Check default options
        assert generator.default_options["temperature"] == 0.1
        assert generator.default_options["num_predict"] == 1024
        assert generator.default_options["num_ctx"] == 2048
        assert generator.default_options["num_gpu"] == 1
        assert generator.default_options["num_thread"] == 4
        
        # Check memory thresholds
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["warning"] == 4.5
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["critical"] == 5.5
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["max_ctx"] == 2048
        assert generator.memory_thresholds["max_tokens"] == 1024
        
        # Check stats initialization
        assert generator.generation_stats["total_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["successful_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["failed_generations"] == 0
        assert generator.generation_stats["avg_generation_time"] == 0.0
        assert generator.generation_stats["memory_warnings"] == 0
    
    def test_code_generator_default_models(self, mock_ollama_client):
        """Test CodeGenerator with default model names."""

    def test_get_memory_usage_with_gpu(self, code_generator):

        mock_gpu.memoryTotal = 6000  # MB

             patch('psutil.virtual_memory') as mock_memory:
